name: constable
example: 单词 constable 的例句||||The constable conducted the suspect to the police station. 警官把嫌疑犯带到派出所。||||The constable kept his temper, and would not be provoked. 那警察压制着自己的怒气，不发火。

name: screwdriver
interpret: n.螺丝起子；伏特加橙汁鸡尾酒
example: 单词 screwdriver 的例句||||He took a screwdriver and teased out the remaining screws. 他拿出螺丝刀把其余的螺丝卸了下来。||||The electric drill can also be used as a screwdriver. 这把电钻也可用作螺丝刀。

name: pajamas
example: 单词 pajamas 的例句||||At bedtime, I take off my clothes and put on my pajamas. 睡觉时，我脱去衣服，换上睡衣。||||He was wearing striped pajamas. 他穿着带条纹的睡衣裤。

name: squeak
interpret: n.吱吱声，逃脱；vi.（发出）吱吱叫，侥幸通过；（俚）告密vt.以短促尖声发出
example: 单词 squeak 的例句||||I don't want to hear another squeak out of you! 我不想再听到你出声！||||We won the game, but it was a narrow squeak. 我们打赢了这场球赛，不过是侥幸取胜。

name: mime
interpret: n.指手画脚，做手势，哑剧演员，哑剧；vi./vt.指手画脚的表演，用哑剧的形式表演
example: 单词 mime 的例句||||Several French mime artists will give some lectures this afternoon. 几位法国哑剧表演艺术家将在今天下午做几场讲座。||||I couldn't speak Chinese, but I showed in mime that I wanted a drink. 我不会讲汉语，但我作摹拟动作表示要一杯饮料。

name: mow
interpret: vt.&vi.割（草、麦等），扫射，皱眉；n.草堆，谷物堆
example: 单词 mow 的例句||||He hired a man to mow the lawn. 他雇人割草。||||We shall have to mow down the tall grass in the big field. 我们得把大田里的高草割掉。

name: earache
example: 单词 earache 的例句||||I have been having an earache for about a week. 我的耳朵已经痛了一个星期了。||||I've had an earache for the past few days. 我耳痛好几天了。

name: measles
example: 单词 measles 的例句||||The doctor is quite definite about Tom having measles. 医生十分肯定汤姆得了麻疹。||||The doctor told her to watch out for symptoms of measles. 医生让她注意麻疹出现的症状。

name: gravy
interpret: n.肉汁；轻易得来的钱，外快
example: 单词 gravy 的例句||||You have spilled gravy on the tablecloth. 你把肉汁泼到台布上了。||||The meat was swimming in gravy. 肉泡在浓汁之中。

name: colonist
example: 单词 colonist 的例句||||The Indians often attacked the settlements of the colonist. 印地安人经常袭击殖民者的定居点。||||In the seventeenth century, the colonist here thatched their roofs with reeds and straw,  just as they did in England. 在17世纪，殖民者在这里用茅草盖屋，就像他们在英国做的一样。

name: lava
example: 单词 lava 的例句||||The lava flowed down the sides of the volcano. 熔岩沿火山坡面涌流而下。||||His anger spilled out like lava. 他的愤怒像火山爆发似的迸发出来。

name: clam
example: 单词 clam 的例句||||Yup! I also like clam soup and sea cucumbers. 对呀! 我还喜欢蛤仔汤和海参。||||The barnacle and the clam are two examples of filter feeders. 藤壶和蛤类是滤过觅食者的两种例子。

name: fiddle
interpret: n.小提琴；vi.拉提琴；不停拨弄，乱动
example: 单词 fiddle 的例句||||She plays the fiddle well. 她小提琴拉得好。||||Don't fiddle with the typewriter. 不要摆弄那架打字机了。

name: ace
interpret: n.A牌；发球得分；佼佼者；adj.杰出的
example: 单词 ace 的例句||||A good negotiator always has more than one ace in the hole. 谈判高手总有数张王牌在手。||||He is an ace mechanic. He can repair any cars. 他是一流的机械师，什么车都会修。

name: florist
example: 单词 florist 的例句||||The florist bunched the flowers up. 花匠把花捆成花束。||||Could you stop at that florist shop over there? 劳驾在那边花店停一下好不好？

name: harp
example: 单词 harp 的例句||||She swept her fingers over the strings of the harp. 她用手指划过竖琴的琴弦。||||He played an Irish melody on the harp. 他用竖琴演奏了一首爱尔兰曲调。

name: yarn
interpret: n.纱，纱线，纺线；奇闻漫谈，旅行轶事
example: 单词 yarn 的例句||||I stopped to have a yarn with him. 我停下来跟他聊天。||||The basic structural unit of yarn is the fiber. 纤维是纱的基本结构单元。

name: dough
example: 单词 dough 的例句||||She formed the dough into squares. 她把生面团捏成四方块。||||The baker is kneading dough. 那位面包师在揉面。

name: hurdle
interpret: n.跳栏，栏架；障碍，困难；vi.进行跨栏赛
example: 单词 hurdle 的例句||||The weather will be the biggest hurdle so I have to be ready. 天气将会是最大的障碍，所以我必须要作好准备。||||She clocked 11. 6 seconds for the 80 metre hurdle. 八十米跳栏赛跑她跑了十一秒六。

name: syrup
example: 单词 syrup 的例句||||I skimmed the foam from the boiling syrup. 我撇去了煮沸糖浆上的泡沫。||||Tinned fruit usually has a lot of syrup with it. 罐头水果通常都有许多糖浆。

name: envelop
interpret: vt.包，封，遮盖；包围；n.信封，包裹
example: 单词 envelop 的例句||||All combine to form a layer of mist to envelop this region. 织成一层烟雾又笼罩着这个地区。||||The dust cloud will envelop the planet within weeks. 产生的尘云将会笼罩整个星球长达几周。

name: ram
interpret: (random access memory)随机存取存储器n. 公羊；撞锤；撞击装置；有撞角的军舰；（水压机的）[机] 活塞；v. 撞击；填塞；强迫通过或接受
example: 单词 ram 的例句||||512k RAM is recommended and 640k RAM is preferred. 推荐配置为512K内存，640K内存则更佳。||||Be careful of that ram —it butts you. 小心那只公羊, 它会用角撞你。

name: tablecloth
example: 单词 tablecloth 的例句||||He sat there ruminating and picking at the tablecloth. 他坐在那儿沉思，轻轻地抚弄着桌布。||||She smoothed down a wrinkled tablecloth. 她把起皱的桌布熨平了。

name: chubby
example: 单词 chubby 的例句||||He is stocky though not chubby. 他长得敦实，可并不发胖。||||The short and chubby gentleman over there is our new director. 那个既矮又胖的绅士是我们的新主任。

name: consonant
example: 单词 consonant 的例句||||The quality of this suit isn't quite consonant with its price. 这套衣服的质量和价钱不相称。||||These are common consonant clusters at the beginning of words. 这些单词的开头有相同辅音组合。

name: omen
example: 单词 omen 的例句||||The superstitious regard it as a bad omen. 迷信的人认为那是一种恶兆。||||Could this at last be a good omen for peace? 这是否终于可以视作和平的吉兆了？

name: cub
example: 单词 cub 的例句||||The lion cub's mother was hunting for what she needs. 这只幼师的母亲正在捕猎。||||The cub licked the milk from its mother's breast. 这头幼兽吸吮着它妈妈的奶水。

name: canopy
example: 单词 canopy 的例句||||The trees formed a leafy canopy above their heads. 树木在他们头顶上空形成了一个枝叶茂盛的遮篷。||||They lay down under a canopy of stars. 他们躺在繁星点点的天幕下。

name: killing
interpret: n.巨额利润；突然赚大钱，发大财
example: 单词 killing 的例句||||Investors are set to make a killing from the sell-off. 投资者准备清仓以便大赚一笔。||||Last week my brother made a killing on Wall Street. 上个周我兄弟在华尔街赚了一大笔。

name: orphanage
example: 单词 orphanage 的例句||||They dispensed new clothes to the children in the orphanage. 他们把新衣服发给孤儿院的小孩们。||||They gave the proceeds of the sale to the orphanage. 他们把销售的收入给了这家孤儿院。

name: syllabus
example: 单词 syllabus 的例句||||Have you got next year's syllabus? 你拿到明年的教学大纲了吗？ ||||We must try to diversify the syllabus to attract more students. 我们应该使教学大纲内容多样化，可以多吸引学生。

name: vat
example: 单词 vat 的例句||||The office is asking for the vat papers. 办事处要有关增值税的文件。||||His father emptied sacks of stale rye bread into the vat. 他父亲把一袋袋发霉的黑面包倒进大桶里。

name: eel
example: 单词 eel 的例句||||He used an eel spear to catch an eel. 他用一只捕鳗叉捕鳗鱼。||||In Suzhou, there was a restaurant that specialized in eel noodles. 苏州有一家饭馆，他们那里的招牌菜是鳗鱼面。

name: sonata
example: 单词 sonata 的例句||||He played a piano sonata of his own composition. 他弹奏了一首自作的钢琴奏鸣曲。||||The young boy played the violin sonata masterfully. 那个小男孩的小提琴奏鸣曲拉得很熟练。

name: misty
example: 单词 misty 的例句||||He crossed over to the window to see if it was still misty. 他走到窗户那儿，看看是不是还有雾霭。||||The misty scene had a dreamy quality about it. 雾景给人以梦幻般的感觉。

name: janitor
example: 单词 janitor 的例句||||The janitor wiped on the windows with his rags. 看门人用褴褛的衣服擦着窗户。||||The janitor swept the floors and locked up the building every night. 那个看门人每天晚上负责打扫大楼的地板和锁门。

name: moody
interpret: adj.心情不稳的，易怒的，喜怒无常的
example: 单词 moody 的例句||||He relapsed into a moody silence. 他又重新陷于忧郁的沉默中。||||I'd never marry that girl. She's so moody. 我决不会和那女孩结婚的。她太易怒了。

name: arcade
interpret: n.拱廊；(一侧或两侧有商店的)通道
example: 单词 arcade 的例句||||At this time of the morning, the arcade was almost empty. 在早晨的这个时候，拱廊街上几乎空无一人。||||In our shopping arcade, you can find different kinds of souvenir. 在我们的拱廊市场， 你可以发现许多的纪念品。

name: sitcom
interpret: n.情景喜剧，（广播、电视的）系列幽默剧
example: 单词 sitcom 的例句||||This sitcom is produced in cooperation with Hong Kong TV. 这部连续剧是同香港电视台联合制作的。||||I heard that a new sitcom is coming out next season. 我听说下一季会推出一个新的情境喜剧。

name: hiccup
interpret: n.打嗝；vi.打嗝；vt.呃逆着（或间断地）说出
example: 单词 hiccup 的例句||||When you have to hiccup, drink a glass of cold water. 当你不得不打嗝时，喝一杯冷水就好了。||||How long did he hiccup? 他打嗝打了多久？

name: amphibian
interpret: n.两栖动物；水陆两用飞机和车辆
example: 单词 amphibian 的例句||||The frog is an amphibian, which means it can live on land and in water. 青蛙属于两栖动物，也就是说它既能生活在陆地上也能生活在水里。||||Amphibian is an important specie in ecosystem and has profound meaning in the ecotoxicology evaluation. 两栖类是生态系统中的重要物种，并且对环境毒理评价有着深远意义。

name: antelope
example: 单词 antelope 的例句||||Choosing the antelope shows that China wants a Green Olympics. 选择藏羚羊表示中国需要绿色奥运。||||The tiger was dragging the antelope across the field. 老虎拖着羚羊穿过原野。

name: eyewitness
example: 单词 eyewitness 的例句||||The police questioned several eyewitness to the murder. 警察询问了谋杀案的几位目击者。||||He was the only eyewitness of the robbery. 他是那起抢劫案的唯一目击者。

name: entirely
interpret: ad.全部地，完整地；完全地，彻底地
example: 单词 entirely 的例句||||The fire was entirely caused by their neglect of duty. 那场火灾完全是由于他们失职而引起的。||||His life was entirely given up to the educational work. 他的一生统统献给了教育工作。

name: meander
interpret: n.河流的曲折，漫步，迂回旅行；vt.缓慢而弯曲地流动，漫谈；vi.漫步；漫谈
example: 单词 meander 的例句||||Visitors and locals alike meander along the sidewalks of the Seine River. 游客与当地人沿着塞纳河岸漫步聊天。||||They tumble down mountainsides and meander through flat farmlands. 它们滚滚冲下山脊，蜿蜒穿过平坦的农田。

name: passbook
example: 单词 passbook 的例句||||You fill out this application form and we'll issue you a passbook. 你填好这张申请表，我们会给你一本存折。||||Would you please give your withdrawal slip and your passbook? 请把您的取款条和存折给我好吗？

name: dedication
interpret: n.奉献，献身，致力，题献，献辞
example: 单词 dedication 的例句||||We admire her courage, compassion and dedication. 我们钦佩她的勇气、爱心和奉献精神。||||Her dedication to her work was admirable. 她对工作的奉献精神可钦可佩。

name: denim
interpret: n.斜纹棉布；斜纹棉布裤，牛仔裤
example: 单词 denim 的例句||||She wore pale blue denim shorts and a white denim work shirt. 她穿着一条淡蓝色的斜纹粗棉布短裤，一件白粗布工作服上衣。||||Dennis was dressed in denim jeans. 丹尼斯穿了一条牛仔裤。

name: perseverance
example: 单词 perseverance 的例句||||It may take some perseverance to find the right people. 要找到合适的人也许需要有点锲而不舍的精神。||||Perseverance leads to success. 有恒心就能胜利。

name: phonetic
interpret: adj.语言的，语言上的，表示语音的
example: 单词 phonetic 的例句||||Our department has engaged a foreign teacher as phonetic adviser. 我们系已经聘请了一位外籍老师作为语音顾问。||||English phonetic teaching is an important teaching step in elementary stages. 语音教学是英语基础阶段重要的教学环节。

name: ramp
interpret: n.暴怒，斜坡，坡道；vi.作恐吓姿势，暴怒，加速；vt.加速
example: 单词 ramp 的例句||||That driver drove the car up the ramp. 那司机将车开上了斜坡。||||The factory don't have that capacity to ramp up. 这家工厂没有能力加速生产。

name: smear
interpret: vt.涂抹；诽谤，玷污；vi.被弄脏；n.污点；诽谤，污蔑
example: 单词 smear 的例句||||He has been spreading false stories in an attempt to smear us. 他一直在散布谎言企图诽谤我们。||||There's a smear on your shirt. 你衬衫上有个污点。

name: workload
example: 单词 workload 的例句||||An assistant one day a week would ease my workload. 每周有一天配一个助手就会减轻我的工作负担。||||He's always grousing about the workload. 他总是抱怨工作量大。

name: canny
example: 单词 canny 的例句||||He was far too canny to risk giving himself away. 他非常谨慎，不会冒险暴露自己。||||But I'm trying to be a little canny about it. 但是我想对此谨慎一些。

name: desktop
interpret: n.桌面管理系统程序；台式
example: 单词 desktop 的例句||||My computer is a desktop computer of excellent quality. 我的计算机是品质卓越的台式计算机。||||Do you know which one is better, a laptop or a desktop? 你知道哪一种更好，笔记本还是台式机？

name: reconstruction
example: 单词 reconstruction 的例句||||The country faces a huge task of national reconstruction following the war. 战后，该国面临着重建家园的艰巨任务。||||In the period of reconstruction, technique decides everything. 在重建时期，技术决定一切。

name: plankton
example: 单词 plankton 的例句||||Plankton is at the bottom of the marine food chain. 浮游生物处于海洋食物链的最底层。||||The plankton in the sea feeds many kinds of animals. 海的浮游生物成为很多种动物的食物。

name: rejuvenate
interpret: vt.(使)返老还童；(使)恢复活力；vi.复原；变年轻
example: 单词 rejuvenate 的例句||||The mountain air will rejuvenate you. 山里的空气会使你恢复活力。||||Exercise is perhaps the most effective way to rejuvenate your skin. 锻炼可能是使皮肤恢复活力的最好手段。

name: defensive
example: 单词 defensive 的例句||||Their questions about the money put her on the defensive. 他们问到钱的问题，使她警觉起来。||||The Government hastily organized defensive measures against the raids. 政府急忙布置了防卫措施抵御空袭。

name: geographer
example: 单词 geographer 的例句||||His grandfather is a geographer. 他的祖父是一位地理学家。||||Li Siguang is a famous geographer. 李四光是一位著名的地理学家。

name: feverish
example: 单词 feverish 的例句||||He is too feverish to rest. 他兴奋得安静不下来。||||They worked with feverish haste to finish the job. 为了完成此事他们以狂热的速度工作着。

name: weaver
example: 单词 weaver 的例句||||She was a fast weaver and the cloth was very good. 她织布织得很快，而且布的质量很好。||||The eager weaver did not notice my confusion. 热心的纺织工人没有注意到我的狼狈相。

name: ashtray
example: 单词 ashtray 的例句||||He knocked out his pipe in the big glass ashtray. 他在大玻璃烟灰缸里磕净烟斗。||||She threw the cigarette butt into the ashtray. 她把烟头扔进烟灰缸。

name: frightful
example: 单词 frightful 的例句||||How frightful to have a husband who snores! 有一个发鼾声的丈夫多讨厌啊！||||We're having frightful weather these days. 这几天天气坏极了。

name: citizenship
interpret: n.市民权，公民权，国民的义务(身份)
example: 单词 citizenship 的例句||||He was born in Sweden, but he doesn't have Swedish citizenship. 他在瑞典出生，但没有瑞典公民身分。||||Ten years later, she chose to take Australian citizenship. 十年后，她选择了澳大利亚国籍。

name: archaeological
example: 单词 archaeological 的例句||||That was a great archaeological find. 那是一次了不起的考古发现。||||The discovery is of great archaeological value. 这一发现有很大的考古学意义。

name: fluency
example: 单词 fluency 的例句||||More practice will make you speak with greater fluency. 多练习就可以使你的口语更流利。||||Some young children achieve great fluency in their reading. 一些孩子小小年纪阅读已经非常流畅。

name: submission
interpret: n.服从，投降；温顺，谦虚；提出
example: 单词 submission 的例句||||The defeated general showed his submission by giving up his sword. 战败将军缴剑表示投降。||||No enemy can frighten us into submission. 任何敌人的恐吓都不能使我们屈服。

name: airfield
example: 单词 airfield 的例句||||The foreign guests were motored from the airfield to the hotel. 用车把外宾从机场送到旅馆。||||The airfield was seized by enemy troops. 机场被敌军占领。

name: piracy
interpret: n.海盗行为，剽窃，著作权侵害
example: 单词 piracy 的例句||||The government has already adopted effective measures against piracy. 政府已采取有效措施惩治盗版行为。||||They made the place a notorious centre of piracy. 他们把这地方变成了臭名昭著的海盗中心。

name: vanilla
example: 单词 vanilla 的例句||||He used to love milk flavoured with vanilla. 他过去常爱喝带香草味的牛奶。||||I added a dollop of vanilla ice-cream to the pie. 我在馅饼里加了一块香草冰激凌。

name: knack
interpret: n.诀窍，做事情的灵巧的，便利的方法
example: 单词 knack 的例句||||He has a knack of teaching arithmetic. 他教算术有诀窍。||||Making omelettes isn't difficult, but there's a knack to it. 做煎蛋饼并不难，但有窍门。

name: naturalist
interpret: n.博物学家(尤指直接观察动植物者)
example: 单词 naturalist 的例句||||He was a printer by trade and naturalist by avocation. 他从事印刷业，同时是个博物学爱好者。||||The naturalist told us many stories about birds. 博物学家给我们讲述了许多有关鸟儿的故事。

name: vigour
example: 单词 vigour 的例句||||She is full of vigour and enthusiasm. 她有热情，有朝气。||||At 40, he was in his prime and full of vigour. 他40岁时正年富力强。

name: alteration
example: 单词 alteration 的例句||||The shirt needs alteration. 这件衬衣需要改一改。||||He easily perceived there was an alteration in my countenance. 他立刻看出我的脸色和往常有些不同。

name: aromatic
example: 单词 aromatic 的例句||||It has an agreeable aromatic smell. 它有一种好闻的香味。||||It is light, fruity aromatic and a perfect choice for ending a meal. 它是口感轻淡，圆润，芳香的, 是用于结束一顿饭完美的选择。

name: gaseous
example: 单词 gaseous 的例句||||Air whether in the gaseous or liquid state is a fluid. 空气，无论是气态的或是液态的，都是一种流体。||||Freon exists both in liquid and gaseous states. 氟利昂有液态和气态两种形态。

name: binary
interpret: adj.二，双；二进制的；n.双(体)；联星
example: 单词 binary 的例句||||Computers operate using binary numbers. 计算机运行运用二进位制。||||Let us try converting the number itself to binary. 我们试一试，把这个数本身变成二进制数。

name: derivative
interpret: n.派(衍)生物；adj.非独创性的，模仿他人的
example: 单词 derivative 的例句||||His paintings are really quite derivative. 他的画实在没有创意。||||Derivative works are far more complicated. 派生作品更加复杂。

name: corrosion
interpret: n.腐蚀，侵蚀；渐渐毁坏，渐衰
example: 单词 corrosion 的例句||||Corrosion is not covered by the warranty. 腐蚀不在保修范围之内。||||Zinc is used to protect other metals from corrosion. 锌被用来保护其他金属不受腐蚀。

name: psychiatrist
interpret: n.精神病专家；精神病医师
example: 单词 psychiatrist 的例句||||He went to a psychiatrist about his compulsive gambling. 他去看精神科医生治疗不能自拔的赌瘾。||||The psychiatrist corrected him gently. 精神病医师彬彬有礼地纠正他。

name: algebra
example: 单词 algebra 的例句||||He was not good at algebra in middle school. 他中学时不擅长代数。||||The boy can't figure out the algebra problems. 这个男孩做不出这道代数题。

name: voucher
example: 单词 voucher 的例句||||The government should run a voucher system. 政府应该施行凭证制度。||||Whenever cash is paid out, a voucher or receipt should be obtained. 无论何时只要支付现金，就必须要有一张凭据或者收据。

name: furry
interpret: adj.毛皮的；似毛皮的；毛皮制的
example: 单词 furry 的例句||||This furry material will make a warm coat for the winter. 这件毛皮料在冬天会是一件保暖的大衣。||||Mugsy is a big furry brown dog, who wiggles when she is happy. 马格斯是一只棕色大长毛狗，当她高兴得时候她会摇尾巴。

name: acronym
example: 单词 acronym 的例句||||That's a mouthful of an acronym for a very simple technology. 对于一项非常简单的技术来说，这是一个很绕口的缩写词。||||TSDF is an acronym for Treatment, Storage and Disposal Facilities. TSDF是处理，储存和处置设施的一个缩写。

name: plaza
example: 单词 plaza 的例句||||They designated the new shopping centre York Plaza. 他们给这个新购物中心定名为约克购物中心。||||The plaza is teeming with undercover policemen. 这个广场上布满了便衣警察。

name: allergy
interpret: n.(因食物、药物等而引起的)过敏症
example: 单词 allergy 的例句||||He developed an allergy to pollen. 他对花粉过敏。||||The patient had an allergy to penicillin. 该患者对青霉素过敏。

name: wed
example: 单词 wed 的例句||||The couple eventually wed after three year engagement. 这对夫妇在订婚三年后终于结婚了。||||The prince was very determined to wed one of the king's daughters. 王子下定决心要娶国王的其中一位女儿。

name: halve
interpret: vt.分成两半，平分；减少到一半
example: 单词 halve 的例句||||Let's halve the project between our two teams. 让我们两个队平均分担这项工程吧。||||I'll halve expenses with you. 我要跟你平均分摊费用。

name: waddle
interpret: vi.摇摆地走；n.摇摆的走路(样子)
example: 单词 waddle 的例句||||I am pregnant. I waddle awkwardly and my big stomach pressed against the weight of the world. 我怀孕了，我滑稽可笑地瞒珊而行，大肚子上压着全世界的重量。||||We waddle and hop and have lots of fun. 我们走起路来摇摇摆摆，还一跳一跳的。我们的生活很有趣。

name: mammoth
interpret: n.长毛象；adj.长毛象似的，巨大的
example: 单词 mammoth 的例句||||You can only undertake mammoth changes if the finances are there. 资金到位的情况下方可进行重大变革。||||Building the new railroad will be a mammoth job. 修建那条新铁路将是一项巨大工程。

name: vaccination
example: 单词 vaccination 的例句||||Vaccination is a preventive against smallpox. 种痘是预防天花的方法。||||Doctors suggest getting a tetanus vaccination every ten years. 医生建议每十年注射一次破伤风疫苗。

name: bungalow
interpret: n.平房，周围有阳台的木造小平房
example: 单词 bungalow 的例句||||A bungalow does not have an upstairs. 平房没有上层。||||The old couple sold that large house and moved into a small bungalow. 老两口卖掉了那幢大房子，搬进了小平房。

name: rhythmic
example: 单词 rhythmic 的例句||||Her breathing became more rhythmic. 她的呼吸变得更有规律了。||||Good breathing is slow, rhythmic and deep. 健康的呼吸方式缓慢深沉而有节奏。

name: volcanic
interpret: adj.火山的；象火山的；由火山引起的
example: 单词 volcanic 的例句||||There have been several volcanic eruptions this year. 今年火山爆发了好几次。||||Volcanic activity has created thermal springs and boiling mud pools. 火山活动产生了温泉和沸腾的泥浆池。

name: ointment
example: 单词 ointment 的例句||||Your foot will feel better after the application of this ointment. 敷用这药膏后，你的脚会感到舒服些。||||This herbal ointment will help to close up your wound quickly. 这种中草药膏会帮助你的伤口很快愈合。

name: watery
interpret: adj.有水的，水汪汪的；湿的，湿润的
example: 单词 watery 的例句||||In his watery eyes there is an expression of distrust. 他那含泪的眼睛流露出不信任的神情。||||Her eyes became watery because of the smoke. 因为烟熏，她的双眼变得泪汪汪的。

name: blister
interpret: n.水疱；(油漆等的)气泡；vt.(使)起泡；痛打；猛烈抨击；vi. 起水泡
example: 单词 blister 的例句||||I got a huge blister on my foot and I couldn't run any farther. 我脚上长了一个大水泡，没办法继续跑。||||I have a blister on my heel because my shoe is too tight. 鞋子太紧了，我脚后跟起了个泡。

name: sprain
example: 单词 sprain 的例句||||He got a foot sprain in his ankle. 他脚踝受了严重的扭伤。||||The sprain made my ankle swell up. 我的脚踝扭伤肿了起来。

name: curiously
interpret: adv.有求知欲地；好问地；奇特地
example: 单词 curiously 的例句||||He looked curiously at the people. 他好奇地看着那些人。||||He took long stealthy strides. His hands were curiously cold. 他迈着悄没声息的大步。他的双手出奇地冷。

name: utterly
example: 单词 utterly 的例句||||Utterly devoted to the people, he gave his life in saving his patients. 他忠于人民，把毕生精力用于挽救患者的生命。||||I was utterly ravished by the way she smiled. 她的微笑使我完全陶醉了。

name: linguist
interpret: n.语言学家；精通数种外国语言者
example: 单词 linguist 的例句||||I used to be a linguist till I become a writer. 过去我是个语言学家，后来成了作家。||||Professor Cui has a high reputation as a linguist. 崔教授作为语言学家名声很高。

name: charisma
interpret: n.(大众爱戴的)领袖气质，魅力
example: 单词 charisma 的例句||||He has enormous charisma. He is a giant of a man. 他有超凡的个人魅力，是个伟人。||||I don't have the charisma to pull a crowd this size. 我没有那么大的魅力，能吸引这么多人。

name: fascist
interpret: adj.法西斯主义的；法西斯党的；n.法西斯主义者，法西斯分子
example: 单词 fascist 的例句||||The strikers were roughed up by the fascist cops. 罢工工人遭到法西斯警察的殴打。||||They succeeded in overthrowing the fascist dictatorship. 他们成功推翻了法西斯独裁统治。

name: forensic
example: 单词 forensic 的例句||||The report included his interpretation of the forensic evidence. 该报告包括他对法庭证据的诠释。||||The judge concluded the proceeding on 10:30 Am after one hour of forensic debate. 经过近一个小时的法庭辩论后，法官于10时30分宣布休庭。

name: superstitious
example: 单词 superstitious 的例句||||They aim to deliver the people who are in bondage to superstitious belief. 他们的目的在于解脱那些受迷信束缚的人。||||These superstitious practices should be abolished as soon as possible. 这些迷信做法应尽早取消。

name: brunch
example: 单词 brunch 的例句||||They eat much the same thing for brunch every day. 每天早午餐他们总是吃同样的东西。||||What did you have for your brunch? 你早午饭都吃些什么?

name: Moslem
interpret: n.回教徒，穆罕默德信徒；adj.回教徒的，回教的
example: 单词 Moslem 的例句||||Moslem women used to veil their faces before going into public. 信回教的妇女出门之前往往用面纱把脸遮起来。||||If possible every Moslem must make the pilgrimage to Mecca once in his life. 如有可能，每个回教徒一生中必须去麦加朝觐一次。

name: punctuate
example: 单词 punctuate 的例句||||The pupils have not yet learned to punctuate correctly. 小学生尚未学会正确使用标点符号。||||Be sure to punctuate your sentences with the correct marks in the right places. 一定要在你文章句子中的正确地方标上正确的标点符号。

name: subtraction
example: 单词 subtraction 的例句||||We do addition and subtraction in arithmetic. 在算术里，我们作加减运算。||||They made a subtraction of 50 dollars from my salary. 他们从我的薪水里扣除了五十美元。

name: extraordinarily
example: 单词 extraordinarily 的例句||||She is an extraordinarily beautiful girl. 她是个美丽非凡的姑娘。||||The sea was extraordinarily calm that morning. 那天清晨，大海出奇地宁静。

name: cuff
interpret: n.袖口；手铐；护腕；vt.用手铐铐；上袖口
example: 单词 cuff 的例句||||She hoped they wouldn't cuff her hands behind her back. 她希望他们不要把她反铐起来。||||Would you please draw together the snag in my cuff? 请你把我袖口上的裂口缝上好吗？

name: flora
example: 单词 flora 的例句||||The subtropical island has a remarkably rich native flora. 这个亚热带岛屿有相当丰富的乡土植物种类。||||All flora need water and light. 一切草木都需要水和阳光。

name: Buddha
example: 单词 Buddha 的例句||||Several women knelt down before the statue of Buddha and prayed. 几个妇女跪在佛像前祈祷。||||He has kept the figure of Buddha for luck. 为了图吉利他一直保存着这尊佛像。

name: Nazi
interpret: n.纳粹分子，adj.纳粹党的，纳粹的
example: 单词 Nazi 的例句||||They declare the Nazi regime overthrown and sue for peace. 他们宣布纳粹政权已被推翻，并出面求和。|||| Nazi closes those war criminals inside their concentration camp. 纳粹把那些战犯关在他们的集中营里。

name: detest
example: 单词 detest 的例句||||I detest people who tell lies. 我恨说谎的人。||||The workers detest his overbearing manner. 工人们很讨厌他那盛气凌人的态度。

name: botanist
example: 单词 botanist 的例句||||The botanist introduced a new species of plant to the region. 那位植物学家向该地区引入了一种新植物。||||I had never talked with a botanist before, and I found him fascinating. 我从没有接触过植物学那一类的学者，我觉得他说话极有吸引力。

name: filthy
example: 单词 filthy 的例句||||The whole river has been fouled up with filthy waste from factories. 整条河都被工厂的污秽废物污染了。||||You really should throw out that filthy old sofa and get a new one. 你真的应该扔掉那张肮脏的旧沙发，然后再去买张新的。

name: implant
example: 单词 implant 的例句||||A good teacher should implant high ideals in children. 好教师应该把高尚理想灌输给孩子们。||||The operation to implant the artificial heart took two hours. 人工心脏植入手术花费了两小时。

name: pessimist
interpret: n.悲观者；悲观主义者；厌世
example: 单词 pessimist 的例句||||An optimist laughs to forget. A pessimist forgets to laugh. 乐观者笑着忘却，悲观者忘记怎样笑。||||The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees opportunity in every difficulty. 悲观者在每个机会中都看到困难，乐观者在每个困难中都看到机会。

name: hydrocarbon
example: 单词 hydrocarbon 的例句||||During incomplete combustion some of the hydrocarbon fuel is cracked. 在不完全的燃烧中，一些烃燃料裂解。||||The hydrocarbon must be an alkene. 这个碳氢化合物必定是烯烃。

name: isotope
example: 单词 isotope 的例句||||The isotope ratio is directly used for comparing oils or gases. 同位素比率直接用于比较各种石油或天然气。||||How to apply a radio isotope? 如何运用放射性同位素？

name: magnesium
example: 单词 magnesium 的例句||||Magnesium is the nutrient element in plant growth. 镁是植物生长的营养要素。||||The water contains high amounts of magnesium. 这水含有大量的镁。

name: neutron
example: 单词 neutron 的例句||||Neutron is neutral and slightly heavier than the proton. 中子是中性的，比质子略重。||||Based on the neutron energy, the value of weighting factor was given. 根据中子能量给出了相应的辐射权重因子的数值。

name: prefix
interpret: n.前缀；vt.加…作为前缀；置于前面
example: 单词 prefix 的例句||||We prefix "Mr."to a man's name. 我们在男士的姓名前加“先生”。||||In the word "unimportant ", "un-" is a prefix. 在单词“unimportant”中“un”是前缀。

name: anthem
example: 单词 anthem 的例句||||All those present were standing solemnly when the national anthem was played. 奏国歌时全场肃立。||||As he stood on the winner's rostrum, he sang the words of the national anthem. 他站在冠军领奖台上，唱起了国歌。

name: binder
interpret: n.包扎物，包扎工具；[法]临时契约；粘合剂；装订工
example: 单词 binder 的例句||||The cloth flower snaps on with a special binder. 这布花是用一种特殊的粘合剂固定住的。||||Purified water was used as liquid binder. 纯净水作为液体粘合剂。

name: dynamite
example: 单词 dynamite 的例句||||The workmen detonated the dynamite. 工人们把炸药引爆了。||||The philosopher was still political dynamite. 那位哲学家仍旧是政治上的爆炸性人物。

name: conservatory
interpret: n.温室，音乐学院；adj.保存性的，有保存力的
example: 单词 conservatory 的例句||||At the conservatory, he learned how to score a musical composition. 在音乐学校里，他学会了怎样谱曲。||||The modern conservatory is not an environment for nurturing plants. 这个现代化温室的环境不适合培育植物。

name: hilarious
example: 单词 hilarious 的例句||||The party got quite hilarious after they brought more wine. 在他们又拿来更多的酒之后，派对变得更加热闹起来。||||We can't stop laughing because the show was so hilarious. 我们笑个不停，因为那个节目太搞笑了。

name: rustle
interpret: vt.沙沙作响；偷盗(牛、马等)；vi.发出沙沙声；n.沙沙声声
example: 单词 rustle 的例句||||She heard a rustle in the bushes. 她听到灌木丛中一阵沙沙声。||||He heard a rustle of leaves in the breeze. 他听到树叶在微风中发出的沙沙声。

name: stimulant
example: 单词 stimulant 的例句||||It is used in medicine for its stimulant quality. 由于它有兴奋剂的特性而被应用于医学。||||Musk is used for perfume and stimulant. 麝香可以用作香料和兴奋剂。

name: preservative
interpret: n.防腐剂；防腐料；保护料；预防药
example: 单词 preservative 的例句||||New timber should be treated with a preservative. 新采的圆木应进行防腐处理。||||Salt is a common food preservative. 盐是一种常用的食物防腐剂。

name: clinch
interpret: v.敲弯，钉牢；确定；扭住对方 [参]clench
example: 单词 clinch 的例句||||Clinch the boards together. 用钉子把木板钉牢在一起。||||We don't accept US dollars, please Swiss francs to clinch a deal business. 我方不收美元，请最好用瑞士法郎来成交生意。

name: secrete
example: 单词 secrete 的例句||||The pores of your body secrete sweat. 身上的毛孔分泌汗液。||||Squirrels secrete a supply of nuts for winter. 松鼠为准备过冬而藏坚果。

name: anthropologist
example: 单词 anthropologist 的例句||||The lecturer is an anthropologist. 这位讲师是人类学家。||||The anthropologist unearthed the skull of an ancient human at the site. 人类学家在这个遗址挖掘出那块古人类的颅骨。

name: forestry
example: 单词 forestry 的例句||||At present, the Chinese forestry is being at a significant transforming period. 当前，我国的林业正处于一个重大的转折时期。||||Anhua is one of the key forestry counties in Hunan province. 安化县是湖南省重点林区县之一。

name: seep
interpret: vi.渗出，渗漏；n.渗漏，小泉，水（油）坑
example: 单词 seep 的例句||||My anger began to seep away. 我的怒火开始消下去了。||||If meteoric water does not evaporate or run overland, it may seep directly into the ground. 如果雨水不从陆地蒸发和流走的话，就可能直接渗入地下。

name: appal
example: 单词 appal 的例句||||I was appalled at the news. 我被这消息吓坏了。||||This "Hamlet" will appal some for being so resolutely unclassical. 新版《哈姆雷特 》如此违背经典，确实惊世骇俗。

name: stylish
interpret: adj.流行的，时髦的；漂亮的，气派的
example: 单词 stylish 的例句||||He's a stylish dresser. 他是个穿着很有格调的人。||||What stylish women are wearing in Paris will be worn by women all over the world. 巴黎女性时装往往会引导世界时装潮流。

name: perspiration
example: 单词 perspiration 的例句||||It is so hot that my clothes are wet with perspiration. 天太热了，我的衣服被汗水湿透了。||||The perspiration was running down my back. 汗从我背上淌下来。

name: smallpox
example: 单词 smallpox 的例句||||In 1742 he suffered a fatal attack of smallpox. 1742年，他染上了致命的天花。||||Were you vaccinated against smallpox as a child? 你小时候打过天花疫苗吗?

name: sonnet
example: 单词 sonnet 的例句||||The composer set a sonnet to music. 作曲家为一首十四行诗谱了曲。||||He wrote a sonnet to his beloved. 他写了一首十四行诗，献给他心爱的人。

name: transfusion
example: 单词 transfusion 的例句||||She soon came to her senses after a blood transfusion. 输血后不久她就苏醒了。||||The doctor kept him alive by a blood transfusion. 医生靠输血使他仍然活着。

name: unnatural
example: 单词 unnatural 的例句||||Did her behaviour seem unnatural in any way? 她有任何反常表现吗？ ||||She has an unnatural smile on her face. 她脸上挂着做作的微笑。

name: arable
example: 单词 arable 的例句||||The terrain changed quickly from arable land to desert. 那个地带很快就从耕地变成了沙漠。||||Do you know how much arable land has been desolated? 你知道有多少土地荒漠化吗？

name: comedian
example: 单词 comedian 的例句||||The comedian tickled the crowd with his jokes. 喜剧演员的笑话把人们逗乐了。||||The comedian enjoyed great popularity during the 30's. 那位喜剧演员在三十年代非常走红。

name: condenser
example: 单词 condenser 的例句||||Their common principle is to use the variable capacity in a condenser. 它们的普遍原理是利用电容器的可变电容。||||Steam is condensed in the condenser. 蒸汽在冷凝器中凝结。

name: grassy
example: 单词 grassy 的例句||||They sat and had their lunch on a grassy hillside. 他们坐在长满草的山坡上吃午饭。||||Cattle move freely across the grassy plain. 牛群自由自在地走过草原。

name: painkiller
example: 单词 painkiller 的例句||||I shall persuade him to take the painkiller. 我将说服他把止痛药吃下去。||||The painkiller only provides him a short respite from his pain. 止痛药仅仅让他在疼痛中有短暂的疏解。

name: reminder
interpret: n.提醒物，纪念品；暗示，提示
example: 单词 reminder 的例句||||I have had another reminder from the library. 我又收到图书馆的催还单。||||It always took a final reminder to get her to pay her share of the rent. 总是得发给她一份最后催缴通知，她才付应该交的房租。

name: adventurous
interpret: adj.爱冒险的；惊心动魄的，惊险的，刺激的
example: 单词 adventurous 的例句||||I was filled with envy at their adventurous lifestyle. 我很羨慕他们敢于冒险的生活方式。||||He was predestined to lead an adventurous life. 他注定要过冒险的生活。

name: blues
example: 单词 blues 的例句||||She was in the back of a smoky bar singing the blues. 她在烟雾弥漫的酒吧深处唱着布鲁斯歌曲。||||He was in the blues on account of his failure in business. 他因事业失败而意志消沉。

name: venue
interpret: n.犯罪地点，审判地，管辖地，发生地点，集合地点
example: 单词 venue 的例句||||The hall provided a venue for weddings and other functions. 大厅给婚礼和其他社会活动提供了场所。||||The chosen venue caused a great controversy among the people. 人们就审判地点的问题产生了极大的争议。

name: actively
example: 单词 actively 的例句||||During this period all the students were actively participating. 在这节课中所有的学生都积极参加。||||We are actively intervening to settle a quarrel. 我们正在积极调解争执。

name: eddy
example: 单词 eddy 的例句||||The motor car disappeared in eddy of dust. 汽车在一片扬尘的涡流中不见了。|||| In Taylor's picture, the eddy is the basic element of turbulence. 在泰勒的描述里，旋涡是湍流的基本要素。

name: harmonious
interpret: adj.和睦的，调和的，和谐的，协调的
example: 单词 harmonious 的例句||||Their harmonious relationship resulted in part from their similar goals. 他们关系融洽的部分原因是他们有着相似的目标。||||The room was painted in harmonious colors. 房间油漆得色彩调和。

name: impractical
interpret: adj.不现实的，不实用的，不切实际的
example: 单词 impractical 的例句||||He was hopelessly impractical when it came to planning new projects. 一到规划新项目，他就完全没有了实际操作的能力。||||An entirely rigid system is impractical. 一套完全死板的体制是不实际的。

name: kerosene
example: 单词 kerosene 的例句||||It is like putting out a fire with kerosene. 这就像用煤油灭火。||||Instead of electricity, there were kerosene lanterns. 没有电，有煤油灯。

name: conjecture
example: 单词 conjecture 的例句||||She felt it no use to conjecture his motives. 她觉得猜想他的动机是没有用的。||||This conjecture is not supported by any real evidence. 这种推测未被任何确切的证据所证实。

name: tattoo
interpret: n.纹身，(皮肤上的)刺花纹；vt.刺花纹于
example: 单词 tattoo 的例句||||I've decided to get my tattoo removed. 我已经决定去掉我身上的纹身。||||He had a tattoo on the back of his hand. 他手背上刺有花纹。

name: vividly
example: 单词 vividly 的例句||||The speaker pictured the suffering of the poor vividly. 演讲者很生动地描述了穷人的生活。||||The characters in the book are vividly presented. 这本书里的人物写得栩栩如生。

name: artifice
interpret: n.妙计，高明的手段；狡诈，诡计
example: 单词 artifice 的例句||||The use of mirrors in a room is an artifice to make the room look larger. 利用镜子装饰房间是使房间显得大一点的巧妙办法。||||He displayed a great deal of artifice in decorating his new house. 他在布置新房子中表现出富有的技巧。

name: ballroom
example: 单词 ballroom 的例句||||The boss of the ballroom excused them the fee. 舞厅老板给他们免费。||||I go ballroom dancing twice a week. 我一个星期跳两次交际舞。

name: cancellation
example: 单词 cancellation 的例句||||Heavy seas can cause cancellation of ferry services. 海上风浪太大，可能须要取消渡轮服务。||||Her cancellation of her trip to Paris upset our plan. 她取消了巴黎之行打乱了我们的计划。

name: considerably
interpret: adv.极大地；相当大地；在很大程度上
example: 单词 considerably 的例句||||The economic situation has changed considerably. 经济形势已发生了相当大的变化。||||The gap has narrowed considerably. 分歧大大缩小了。

name: industrialist
example: 单词 industrialist 的例句||||The industrialist's son was kidnapped. 这名实业家的儿子被绑架了。||||Mr. Smith was a wealthy industrialist, but he was not satisfied with life. 史密斯先生是位富有的企业家，可他对生活感到不满意。

name: ledge
interpret: n.壁架，架状突出物；岩架，岩礁
example: 单词 ledge 的例句||||They paid out the line to lower him to the ledge. 他们放出绳子使他降到那块岩石的突出部分。||||Suddenly he struck his toe on a rocky ledge and fell. 突然他的脚趾绊在一块突出的岩石上，摔倒了。

name: embarrassment
interpret: n.尴尬；使人为难的人(事物)；障碍；窘迫
example: 单词 embarrassment 的例句||||She could have died away with embarrassment. 她窘迫得要死。||||Coughing at a concert can be a real embarrassment. 在音乐会上咳嗽真会使人难堪。

name: rubble
example: 单词 rubble 的例句||||After the earthquake, it took months to clean up the rubble. 地震后，花了数月才清理完瓦砾。||||After the war many cities were full of rubble. 战后许多城市到处可见颓垣残壁。

name: rheumatism
example: 单词 rheumatism 的例句||||The damp weather plays the very devil with my rheumatism. 潮湿的天气加重了我的风湿病。||||The hot weather gave the old man a truce from rheumatism. 热天使这位老人暂时免受风湿病之苦。

name: telecommunication
example: 单词 telecommunication 的例句||||Telecommunication is an industry of service. 电信业是一个服务型的行业。||||I only care about the telecommunication quality and the charge. 我只关心通信质量和资费两个方面。

name: bodyguard
example: 单词 bodyguard 的例句||||She has to have an armed bodyguard wherever she goes. 她不管到哪儿都得有带武器的保镖跟从。||||The big guy standing at his side may be his bodyguard. 站在他身旁的那个大个子可能是他的保镖。

name: pollen
example: 单词 pollen 的例句||||Hummingbirds have discovered that nectar and pollen are very nutritious. 蜂鸟发现花蜜和花粉是很有营养的。||||He developed an allergy to pollen. 他对花粉过敏。

name: advisory
interpret: adj.劝告的，忠告的，顾问的，提供咨询
example: 单词 advisory 的例句||||I have worked in an advisory capacity with many hospitals. 我曾在多家医院做过顾问工作。||||He was appointed to the advisory committee last month. 他上个月获任命为顾问委员会委员。

name: salon
interpret: n.[法]沙龙；客厅；营业性的高级服务室
example: 单词 salon 的例句||||Do you go to the hairdresser or beauty salon more than twice a week? 你每周去美容院或美容沙龙超过两次吗？ ||||You can hear a lot of dirt at a salon. 你在沙龙上会听到很多流言蜚语。

name: vaguely
example: 单词 vaguely 的例句||||He had talked vaguely of going to work abroad. 他含糊其词地说了到国外工作的事。||||He looked vaguely before him with unseeing eyes. 他迷迷糊糊的望着前面，对一切都视而不见。

name: treasury
example: 单词 treasury 的例句||||The Treasury was opposed in principle to the proposals. 财政部原则上反对这些提案。||||This book is a treasury of useful information. 这本书是有价值的信息宝库。

name: propeller
example: 单词 propeller 的例句||||The propeller started to spin around. 螺旋桨开始飞快地旋转起来。||||A rope jammed the boat's propeller. 一根绳子卡住了船的螺旋桨。

name: assassination
example: 单词 assassination 的例句||||The assassination of the president brought matters to a head. 总统遭暗杀使事态到了严重关头。||||Lincoln's assassination in 1865 shocked the whole nation. 1865年，林肯遇刺事件震惊全美国。

name: ancestry
example: 单词 ancestry 的例句||||Their ancestry settled the land in 1856. 他们的祖辈1856年在这块土地上定居下来。||||He is an American of French ancestry. 他是法国血统的美国人。

name: clutter
interpret: n.零乱，杂乱；vt.弄乱，把…弄得杂乱
example: 单词 clutter 的例句||||The garage is in such a clutter that we can't find anything. 车库如此凌乱，我们什么也找不到。||||We'll have to clear up all this clutter. 我们得把这一切凌乱的东西整理清楚。

name: columnist
example: 单词 columnist 的例句||||The host was interviewing a local columnist. 节目主持人正在同一位当地的专栏作家交谈。||||She's a columnist for USA Today. 她是《今日美国报》的专栏作家。

name: energize
interpret: vt.给予(某人或某物)精力、能量
example: 单词 energize 的例句||||It is used to energize the city. 它的作用是为城市供给能量。||||This is a great way to energize yourself and give yourself more power! 这种方法非常棒，可以激活你的能量，让你有更多的活力!

name: backbone
interpret: n.脊骨，脊柱，骨干；刚毅，骨气
example: 单词 backbone 的例句||||The Chinese people have backbone. 中国人民有骨气。||||The backbone is an articulate structure. 脊椎骨是一种关节相连的结构。

name: enthusiast
example: 单词 enthusiast 的例句||||He is an enthusiast about politics. 他是个热衷于政治的人。||||He was an enthusiast and loved to evoke enthusiasm in others. 他是一个激情昂扬的人，也热衷于唤起他人心中的激情。

name: predator
interpret: n.捕食其它动物的动物；捕食者
example: 单词 predator 的例句||||The final part of this chapter was devoted to a brief summary of predator species. 本章最后部分简要总结了食肉动物。||||Komodo dragon is the largest living lizard and a fearsome predator. 科摩多龙是目前存在的最大蜥蜴，它是一种令人恐惧的捕食性动物。

name: prospectus
example: 单词 prospectus 的例句||||An order form was included with the prospectus. 订单附在说明书上。||||The school was bogus,  the prospectus was all got up. 这所学校是虚假的，就连这所学校的创办计划书也全是伪造的。

name: chauffeur
interpret: n.(受雇于私人或公司的)司机；vi.为…开车;vt.开车运送
example: 单词 chauffeur 的例句||||The chauffeur handed the old lady from the car. 这个司机搀扶这个老太太下汽车。||||She went out herself and spoke to the chauffeur. 她亲自走出去跟汽车司机说话。

name: consultation
example: 单词 consultation 的例句||||The company has promised wide consultation on its expansion plans. 该公司允诺就其扩展计划广泛征求意见。||||The scheme was developed in close consultation with the local community. 该计划是在同当地社区密切磋商中逐渐形成的。

name: aerobics
example: 单词 aerobics 的例句||||Doing aerobics is a good way to improve one's health. 做有氧健身操是改善健康状况的一个好方法。||||Aren't you going to the aerobics class this morning? 今天上午你不是去上有氧运动课吗？

name: optimal
interpret: adj.最适宜的；最理想的；最令人满意的
example: 单词 optimal 的例句||||What is the optimal mix of private and public property rights in natural resources? 私人和国家的自然资源产权的最适宜的组合是什么？ ||||Optimal path planning is a key link for the sailing contest. 帆船最优行驶路径规划是帆船比赛取胜的关键环节。

name: peek
interpret: vi.偷看，窥视；n.偷偷的一看，一瞥
example: 单词 peek 的例句||||Larry takes a peek out of the window. 赖瑞往窗外偷看了一下。||||Cover your eyes and don't peek. 捂上眼睛，别偷看。

name: stink
interpret: vi.发出恶臭；糟透，招人厌恶；n.恶臭
example: 单词 stink 的例句||||The stink of the rotten fish turned my stomach. 腐烂的鱼臭味使我恶心。||||The room has an awful stink. 那个房间散发着难闻的臭气。

name: den
interpret: n.兽穴；秘密地方；安静的小房间，私室
example: 单词 den 的例句||||There is a big fox den on the back hill. 后山有一个很大的狐狸窝。||||The only way to catch tiger cubs is to go into tiger's den. 不入虎穴焉得虎子。

name: longevity
example: 单词 longevity 的例句||||Good habits promote longevity. 良好的习惯能增长寿命。||||Human longevity runs in families. 人类的长寿具有家族遗传性。

name: dropout
interpret: n.退学的学生；退学；退出者
example: 单词 dropout 的例句||||There is a high dropout rate from some college courses. 有些大学课程的退出率很高。||||In the long haul, she'll regret having been a school dropout. 她终归会后悔，不该中途辍学。

name: deter
example: 单词 deter 的例句||||Failure did not deter us from trying it again. 失败并没有能阻挡我们再次进行试验。||||Dogs can deter unwelcome intruders. 狗能够阻拦不受欢迎的闯入者。

name: embroider
interpret: vt.&vi.刺绣于(布)上；给…添枝加叶，润饰
example: 单词 embroider 的例句||||The editor would take a theme and embroider upon it with drollery. 编辑会将一篇文章以调侃式的幽默笔调加以渲染。||||She wants to embroider a coverlet with flowers and birds. 她想给床罩绣上花鸟。

name: tricky
interpret: adj.狡猾的，奸诈的；(工作等)棘手的，微妙的
example: 单词 tricky 的例句||||I'm in a rather tricky position. Can you help me out? 我的处境很棘手，你能帮我吗？||||He avoided this tricky question and talked in generalities. 他回避了这个非常微妙的问题，只做了个笼统的表述。

name: integration
example: 单词 integration 的例句||||We are working to bring about closer political integration in the EU. 我们正在努力实现欧盟內部更加紧密的政治一体化。||||This was the greatest event in the annals of European integration. 这是欧洲统一史上最重大的事件。

name: photoelectric
example: 单词 photoelectric 的例句||||Photoelectric spectrophotometers give better result. 用光电分光光度计能得到较佳结果。||||Einstein also explained a baffling feature of the photoelectric effect. 爱因斯坦也解释了光电效应里一个令人困扰的现象。

name: pauper
example: 单词 pauper 的例句||||You lived like a pauper when you had plenty of money. 你有大把钱的时候，也活得像个乞丐。||||If you work conscientiously you'll only die a pauper. 你按部就班地干，做到老也是穷死。

name: bribery
example: 单词 bribery 的例句||||FBI found out that the senator committed bribery. 美国联邦调查局查明这个参议员有受贿行为。||||He was charged with bribery. 他被指控受贿。

name: fictitious
example: 单词 fictitious 的例句||||She invented a fictitious boyfriend to put him off. 她虚构出一个男朋友来拒绝他。||||The story my mother told me when I was young is fictitious. 小时候妈妈对我讲的那个故事是虚构的。

name: intonation
example: 单词 intonation 的例句||||The teacher checks for pronunciation and intonation. 老师在检查发音和语调。||||Questions are spoken with a rising intonation. 疑问句是以升调说出来的。

name: expressive
interpret: adj.表现的，表达…的，富于表情的
example: 单词 expressive 的例句||||Black English can be more expressive than standard English. 黑人所使用的英语可能比正式英语更有表现力。||||He had a mobile, expressive, animated face. 他有一张多变的，富于表情的, 生动活泼的脸。

name: chapel
example: 单词 chapel 的例句||||The nimble hero, skipped into a chapel that stood near. 敏捷的英雄跳进近旁的一座小教堂里。||||She was on the peak that Sunday afternoon when she played in chapel. 那个星期天的下午，她在小教堂的演出，可以说是登峰造极。

name: oversight
example: 单词 oversight 的例句||||I consider this a gross oversight on your part. 我把这件事看作是你的一大疏忽。||||Your essay was not marked through an oversight on my part. 由于我的疏忽你的文章没有打分。

name: metropolis
example: 单词 metropolis 的例句||||Shanghai is a metropolis in China. 上海是中国的大都市。||||He was dazzled by the gaiety and splendour of the metropolis. 大都市的花花世界使他感到眼花缭乱。

name: hack
interpret: n.劈，砍，出租马车；vt.劈，砍，干咳；vi.砍
example: 单词 hack 的例句||||He made a hack at the log. 他朝圆木上砍了一下。||||Early settlers had to hack out a clearing in the forest where they could grow crops. 早期移民不得不在森林里劈出空地种庄稼。

name: hacker
interpret: n.能盗用或偷改电脑中信息的人，电脑黑客
example: 单词 hacker 的例句||||The computer hacker wrote that he was from Russia. 这个计算机黑客自称他来自俄罗斯。||||This site was attacked by a hacker last week. 上周这个网站被黑客攻击了。

name: wharf
example: 单词 wharf 的例句||||We fetch up at the wharf exactly on time. 我们准时到达码头。||||We reached the wharf gasping for breath. 我们气喘吁吁地抵达了码头。

name: autonomous
example: 单词 autonomous 的例句||||They proudly declared themselves part of a new autonomous province. 他们自豪地宣布成为新自治省的一部分。||||This is a matter that comes within the jurisdiction of the autonomous region. 这件事是属于自治区权限以内的事务。

name: celestial
example: 单词 celestial 的例句||||The rosy light yet beamed like a celestial dawn. 玫瑰色的红光依然象天上的朝霞一样绚丽。||||Gravity governs the motions of celestial bodies. 万有引力控制着天体的运动。

name: funnel
example: 单词 funnel 的例句||||He poured the petrol into the car through a funnel. 他用一个漏斗把汽油灌入汽车。||||I like the ship with a yellow funnel. 我喜欢那条有黄烟囱的船。

name: juggle
interpret: vt.&vi.变戏法，纂改，欺骗，同时做；n.玩杂耍，纂改，花招
example: 单词 juggle 的例句||||If you juggle with your accounts, you'll get into trouble. 你要是在帐目上做手脚，你可要遇到麻烦了。||||She had to juggle her job and her children. 她得同时兼顾工作和孩子。

name: nautical
example: 单词 nautical 的例句||||A nautical mile is 1, 852 meters. 一海里等于1852米。||||It is 206 nautical miles from our present location. 距离我们现在的位置有206海里。

name: pitcher
interpret: n.(有嘴和柄的)大水罐；(棒球)投手
example: 单词 pitcher 的例句||||He poured the milk out of the pitcher. 他从大罐中倒出牛奶。||||Any pitcher is liable to crack during a tight game. 任何投手在紧张的比赛中都可能会失常。

name: rusty
interpret: adj.生锈的；锈色的；荒废了的
example: 单词 rusty 的例句||||The lock on the door is rusty and won't open. 门上的锁锈住了。||||I haven't practiced my French for months and it's getting rusty. 几个月不用，我的法语又荒疏了。

name: wasp
example: 单词 wasp 的例句||||A wasp stung me on the arm. 黄蜂蜇了我的手臂。||||Through the glass we can see the wasp. 透过玻璃我们可以看到黄蜂。

name: vomit
interpret: vt.&vi.呕吐，作呕；n.呕吐物，吐出物
example: 单词 vomit 的例句||||They gave her salty water to make her vomit. 他们给她喝盐水好让她吐出来。||||She was stricken by pain and began to vomit. 她感到一阵疼痛，开始呕吐起来。

name: dangle
example: 单词 dangle 的例句||||At Christmas, we dangle colored lights around the room. 圣诞节时，我们在房间里挂上彩灯。||||He sits on the edge of the table and dangles his legs. 他坐在桌子边上，摆动著双腿。

name: deception
example: 单词 deception 的例句||||He admitted conspiring to obtain property by deception. 他承认曾与人合谋骗取财产。 ||||He was jailed for two years for fraud and deception. 他因为诈骗和欺诈入狱服刑两年。

name: creed
example: 单词 creed 的例句||||They offended against every article of his creed. 他们触犯了他的每一条戒律。||||Our creed has always been that business is business. 我们的信条一直是公私分明。

name: hoarse
example: 单词 hoarse 的例句||||He asked me a question in a hoarse voice. 他用嘶哑的声音问了我一个问题。||||He was too excited and roared himself hoarse. 他过于激动，嗓子都喊哑了。

name: genre
interpret: n.(文学、艺术等的)类型，体裁，风格
example: 单词 genre 的例句||||My favorite music genre is blues. 我最喜欢的音乐种类是布鲁斯音乐。||||Superficially, this Shakespeare's work seems to fit into the same genre. 从表面上看，莎士比亚的这个剧本似乎属于同一类型。

name: tactile
interpret: adj.触觉的，有触觉的，能触知的
example: 单词 tactile 的例句||||Norris is an expert in the tactile and the tangible. 诺里斯创作最精到之处便是, 他描绘的人物使人看得见摸得着。||||Tactile communication uses touch rather than sight or hearing. 触觉交流，是用触摸感觉，而不是用看或听来感觉。

name: racism
interpret: n.民族主义；种族歧视(意识)
example: 单词 racism 的例句||||He said that racism is endemic in this country. 他说种族主义在该国很普遍。||||Racism causes political instability and violence. 种族主义道致政治动荡和暴力事件。

name: gem
interpret: n.宝石，珠宝；受爱戴的人 [同]jewel
example: 单词 gem 的例句||||The gem is beyond my pocket. 这颗宝石我可买不起。||||The little gem is worth two thousand dollars. 这块小宝石价值两千美元。

name: fiery
interpret: adj.燃烧着的，火红的；暴躁的；激烈的
example: 单词 fiery 的例句||||She has fiery red hair. 她有一头火红的头发。||||His fiery speech agitated the crowd. 他热情洋溢的讲话激动了群众。

name: granite
example: 单词 granite 的例句||||They squared a block of granite. 他们把一块花岗岩加工成四方形。||||The granite overlies the older rocks. 花岗岩躺在磨损的岩石上面。

name: fusion
interpret: n.溶化；熔解；熔化状态，熔和；熔接
example: 单词 fusion 的例句||||Brass is formed by the fusion of copper and zinc. 黄铜是通过铜和锌的熔合而成的。||||This alloy is formed by the fusion of two types of metal. 这种合金是用两种金属熔合而成的。

name: addictive
interpret: adj.(吸毒等)使成瘾的，成为习惯的
example: 单词 addictive 的例句||||The problem with video game is that they're addictive. 电子游戏机的问题在于它们会使人上瘾。||||Cigarettes are highly addictive. 香烟很容易使人上瘾。

name: dune
example: 单词 dune 的例句||||The sand massed to form a dune. 沙积集起来成了沙丘。||||Cute Jim sat on the dune eating a prune in June. 可爱的吉姆在六月天坐在沙丘上吃着话梅。

name: flick
interpret: n.快速的轻打，轻打声，弹开；vt.&vi.轻弹，轻轻拂去，忽然摇动
example: 单词 flick 的例句||||He gave a flick of the whip. 他轻抽一下鞭子。||||By a flick of his whip, he drove the fly from the horse's head. 他用鞭子轻抽了一下，将马头上的苍蝇驱走。

name: millennium
interpret: n.一千年，千禧年；太平盛世
example: 单词 millennium 的例句||||The whole world was counting down to the new millennium. 全世界都在倒计时迎接新千年的到来。||||We waited as the clock ticked away the last few seconds of the old millennium. 我们静候着时钟滴答走过千年的最后几秒钟。

name: sterile
interpret: adj.不毛的，不孕的，无菌的，枯燥的，贫瘠的
example: 单词 sterile 的例句||||This top fits over the bottle and keeps the teat sterile. 这个盖子严实地盖在奶瓶上，保持奶嘴无菌。||||The farmers turned the sterile land into high fields. 农民们把不毛之地变成了高产田。

name: suburban
example: 单词 suburban 的例句||||Suburban shopping centers were springing up all over America. 郊区的商业中心在美国如雨后春笋般地兴起。||||There's a lot of good things about suburban living. 郊区生活是有许多优点。

name: analyst
interpret: n.分析家，化验员；心理分析学家
example: 单词 analyst 的例句||||What can you contribute to the position of a market analyst? 你有什么技能可有助于市场分析员的职务？||||The analyst is required to interpolate values between standards. 分析人员需要在这些标准中插入一些值。

name: glamorous
interpret: adj.富有魅力的；美丽动人的；令人向往的
example: 单词 glamorous 的例句||||The south coast is less glamorous but full of clean and attractive hotels. 南海岸魅力稍逊，但却有很多干净漂亮的宾馆。||||It is hard work and not a glamorous job as portrayed by the media. 这是份苦差，并非像媒体描绘的那般令人向往。

name: oyster
example: 单词 oyster 的例句||||I enjoy eating oyster; it's really delicious. 我喜欢吃牡蛎，它味道真美。||||I find I fairly like eating when he finally persuades me to taste the oyster. 当他最后说服我尝尝牡蛎时，我发现我相当喜欢吃。

name: postgraduate
interpret: adj.大学毕业后的，大学研究院的；n.研究生
example: 单词 postgraduate 的例句||||I didn't put down that I had postgraduate degree. 我没有写上我有硕士学位。||||After college, Mary hopes to do postgraduate work in law school. 大学毕业后，玛丽想在法学院从事研究工作。

name: proofread
example: 单词 proofread 的例句||||I didn't even have the chance to proofread my own report. 我甚至没有机会校对自己的报告。||||Before handing in his application to his teacher, he proofread it again. 交给老师之前，他又将申请书补正了一遍。

name: surgical
interpret: adj.外科的，外科医生的，手术上的
example: 单词 surgical 的例句||||He performs the surgical operations at the Red Cross Hospital. 他在红十字会医院做外科手术。||||All surgical instruments must be sterilised before use. 所有的外科手术器械在使用之前，必须消毒。

name: tumour
example: 单词 tumour 的例句||||The surgeons operated on her for a tumour. 外科医生为她施行了肿瘤切除手术。||||The tumour constricts the nerves. 肿瘤压迫神经。

name: colonize
interpret: vt.建立殖民地，拓殖；定居，居于；vi.开拓殖民地；移居于殖民地
example: 单词 colonize 的例句||||Around 700 Arabs began to colonize East Africa. 公元700年阿拉伯人开始把东非变为殖民地。||||Japan used to colonize many countries in Asia. 日本曾经殖民过许多亚洲国家。

name: innocence
example: 单词 innocence 的例句||||There was a touching air of innocence about the boy. 这个男孩有一种令人感动的天真神情。||||The accused man proved his innocence of the crime. 被告人经证实无罪。

name: treacherous
interpret: adj.不可靠的，有暗藏的危险的；adj.背叛的，背信弃义的
example: 单词 treacherous 的例句||||The surface water made the road treacherous for drivers. 路面的积水对驾车者构成危险。||||The frozen snow was treacherous to walk on. 在冻雪上行走有潜在危险。

name: incite
example: 单词 incite 的例句||||I wanted to point out he was a very good speaker, and could incite a crowd. 我想说明他曾是一个非常出色的演讲家，非常会调动群众的情绪。||||Just a few words will incite him into action. 他只需几句话一将，就会干。

name: nomadic
example: 单词 nomadic 的例句||||This tribe still live a nomadic life. 这个民族仍然过着游牧生活。||||The plowing culture and the nomadic culture are two traditional principal cultures in China. 农耕文化与游牧文化是我国传统的两大主体文化。

name: multinational
interpret: adj.多国的，多种国籍的；n.多国籍公司，跨国公司
example: 单词 multinational 的例句||||The firm was taken over by a multinational consulting firm. 这家公司被一个跨国咨询公司收购。||||He analyzed the relationship between multinational corporations and under-developed countries. 他分析了跨国公司和不发达国家之间的关系。

name: pregnancy
example: 单词 pregnancy 的例句||||Early pregnancy is often accompanied by nausea. 怀孕早期常有恶心的现象。||||Smoking during pregnancy increases the risk of miscarriage. 怀孕期吸烟会增加流产的危险。

name: throb
interpret: vi.震颤，颤动；(急速强烈地)跳动，搏动；n.悸动，脉搏
example: 单词 throb 的例句||||She felt her heart give a great throb. 她感到自己的心怦地跳了一下。||||The drums seemed to throb in his ears. 阵阵鼓声彷佛在他耳边震响。

name: mandate
example: 单词 mandate 的例句||||The President had a clear mandate to end the war. 总统得到明确的授权结束那场战争。||||The General Election gave him no such mandate. 大选并未授予他这种权力。

name: niche
interpret: n.壁龛；合适的职务(环境、位置等)
example: 单词 niche 的例句||||Madeleine placed it carefully in the rocky niche. 玛德琳小心翼翼地把它放在岩石壁龛里。||||The really talented among women would always make their own niche. 妇女中真正有才能的人总是各得其所。

name: monastery
example: 单词 monastery 的例句||||They found an icon in the monastery. 他们在修道院中发现了一个圣像。||||She was appointed the superior of the monastery two years ago. 两年前她被任命为这个修道院的院长。

name: miscarriage
interpret: n.失败，未达到预期的结果；流产
example: 单词 miscarriage 的例句||||The miscarriage of our plans was a great blow. 计划的失败给我们以巨大的打击。||||Women who smoke are more to have a miscarriage. 女性吸烟者更容易流产。

name: labyrinth
example: 单词 labyrinth 的例句||||He wandered through the labyrinth of the alleyways. 他在迷宫似的小巷中闲逛。||||The human mind is a labyrinth. 人的心灵是一座迷宫。

name: molecular
example: 单词 molecular 的例句||||The research will provide direct insight into molecular mechanisms. 这项研究将使人能够直接地了解分子的机理。||||For the pressure to become zero,  molecular bombardment must cease. 当压强趋近于零时，分子的碰撞就停止了。

name: deduction
interpret: n.减除，扣除，减除额；推论，推理，演绎
example: 单词 deduction 的例句||||No deduction in pay is made for absence due to illness. 因病请假不扣工资。||||His deduction led him to the correct conclusion. 他的推断使他得出正确的结论。

name: bough
example: 单词 bough 的例句||||I rested my fishing rod against a pine bough. 我把钓鱼竿靠在一棵松树的大树枝上。||||Every bough was swinging in the wind. 每条树枝都在风里摇摆。

name: brink
interpret: n.(悬崖、河流等的)边缘，边沿
example: 单词 brink 的例句||||The tree grew on the brink of the cliff. 那棵树生长在峭壁的边缘。||||The two countries were poised on the brink of war. 这两个国家处于交战的边缘。

name: confiscate
interpret: vt.没收(私人财产)，把…充公；adj.被没收的
example: 单词 confiscate 的例句||||The police have the right to confiscate any forbidden objects they find. 如发现违禁货物，警方有权查扣。||||Did the teacher confiscate your toy? 老师没收你的玩具了吗？

name: artillery
example: 单词 artillery 的例句||||This is a heavy artillery piece. 这是一门重炮。||||The artillery has more firepower than the infantry. 炮兵火力比步兵大。

name: entice
example: 单词 entice 的例句||||Nothing will entice the children from television. 没有任何东西能把孩子们从电视机前诱开。||||I don't see why the English should want to entice us away from our native land. 我不明白，为什英国人要引诱我们离开自己的国土。

name: glossy
example: 单词 glossy 的例句||||I like these glossy spots. 我喜欢这些闪闪发光的花点。||||She had glossy black hair. 她长着乌黑发亮的头发。

name: inquisitive
interpret: adj.求知欲强的，好奇的，好寻根究底的
example: 单词 inquisitive 的例句||||Children are usually inquisitive. 小孩通常很好问。||||A pat answer is not going to satisfy an inquisitive audience. 陈腔烂调的答案不能满足好奇的听众。

name: hospitable
interpret: adj.好客的；宽容的；有利的，适宜的
example: 单词 hospitable 的例句||||The man is very hospitable. He keeps open house for his friends and fellow-workers. 那人十分好客，无论是他的朋友还是同事，他都盛情接待。||||The locals are hospitable and welcoming. 当地人热情好客。

name: mythology
example: 单词 mythology 的例句||||In Greek mythology, Zeus was the ruler of Gods and men. 在希腊神话中，宙斯是众神和人类的统治者。||||He is the hero of Greek mythology. 他是希腊民间传说中的英雄。

name: saliva
example: 单词 saliva 的例句||||He wiped a dribble of saliva from his chin. 他擦掉了下巴上的几滴口水。||||Saliva dribbled from the baby's mouth. 唾液从婴儿的嘴里流了出来。

name: reiterate
example: 单词 reiterate 的例句||||Let me reiterate that we have absolutely no plans to increase taxation. 让我再一次重申我们绝对没有增税的计划。||||I must reiterate that our position on this issue is very clear. 我必须重申我们对这一项议题的立场很清楚。

name: twitch
interpret: vi.急拉，抽动，痉挛，抽搐；vt. 使抽动；攫取；猛拉；n.扯，阵痛，痉挛
example: 单词 twitch 的例句||||The smell made my dog's nose twitch. 那股气味使我的狗的鼻子抽动着。||||I felt a twitch at my sleeve. 我觉得有人扯了一下我的袖子。

name: journalism
example: 单词 journalism 的例句||||He's a teacher but he does some journalism on the side. 他是教师，可还兼职做一些新闻工作。||||He had an aptitude for journalism. 他有从事新闻工作的才能。

name: dedicated
interpret: adj.一心一意的；献身的；热诚的
example: 单词 dedicated 的例句||||He dedicated his life to the cause of education. 他献身于教育事业。||||His whole energies are dedicated to improve the design. 他的全部精力都放在改进这项设计上了。

name: diabetes
example: 单词 diabetes 的例句||||In case of diabetes,  physicians advise against the use of sugar. 对于糖尿病患者，医生告诫他们不要吃糖。||||Diabetes is caused by a fault in the insulin production of the body. 糖尿病是由体內胰岛素分泌失调引起的。

name: improvise
interpret: vt.&vi.即兴创作；临时准备，临时凑成
example: 单词 improvise 的例句||||If an actor forgets his words, he has to improvise. 演员要是忘记台词，那就只好即兴现编。||||As we've not got the proper materials, we'll just have to improvise. 我们没有弄到合适的材料，只好临时凑合了。

name: malnutrition
example: 单词 malnutrition 的例句||||In Africa, there are a lot of children suffering from severe malnutrition. 在非洲有大批严重营养不良的孩子。||||It is a classic case of malnutrition. 这是营养不良的典型病例。

name: allusion
example: 单词 allusion 的例句||||He made an allusion to a secret plan in his speech. 在讲话中他暗示有一项秘密计划。||||She made no allusion to the incident. 她没有提及那个事件。

name: evasion
example: 单词 evasion 的例句||||The movie star is in prison for tax evasion. 那位影星因为逃税而坐牢。||||The act was passed as a safeguard against tax evasion. 这项法案旨在防止逃税行为。

name: terminology
example: 单词 terminology 的例句||||He particularly criticized the terminology in the document. 他特别批评了文件中使用的术语。||||The article uses rather specialized musical terminology. 这篇文章用了相当专业的音乐术语。

name: regiment
interpret: n.团，多数，管理；v.组织，编成团，统制
example: 单词 regiment 的例句||||As he hated army life, he decide to desert his regiment. 因为他嫌恶军队生活，所以他决心背弃自己所在的那个团。||||They reformed a division into a regiment. 他们将一个师整编成为一个团。

name: scorch
interpret: vt.&vi.烧焦，烤焦；高速疾驶；n.烧焦处，焦痕
example: 单词 scorch 的例句||||I could not wash away the mark of the scorch. 我洗不掉这焦痕。||||This material will scorch easily if it is too near the fire. 这种材料如果太靠近炉火很容易烤焦。

name: scarlet
interpret: n.深红色，绯红色，红衣；adj.绯红色的
example: 单词 scarlet 的例句||||The scarlet leaves of the maples contrast well with the dark green of the pines. 深红的枫叶和暗绿的松树形成了明显的对比。||||The glowing clouds are growing slowly pale, scarlet, bright red, and then light red. 天空的霞光渐渐地淡下去了，深红的颜色变成了绯红，绯红又变为浅红。

name: taper
interpret: n.小蜡烛，尖细，渐弱；adj.尖细的；v.逐渐变小
example: 单词 taper 的例句||||You'd better taper off the amount of time given to rest. 你最好逐渐地减少休息时间。||||Pulmonary arteries taper towards periphery. 肺动脉向周围逐渐变细。

name: scarcity
example: 单词 scarcity 的例句||||The scarcity of skilled workers is worrying the government. 熟练工人的缺乏困扰着政府。||||The scarcity of fruit was caused by the drought. 水果供不应求是由于干旱造成的。

name: saturation
example: 单词 saturation 的例句||||The company's sales are now close to saturation in many western countries. 这家公司的产品销售量在许多西方国家已接近饱和。||||Road traffic has reached saturation point. 公路交通已达到饱和点。

name: tack
example: 单词 tack 的例句||||He is hammering a tack into the wall to hang a picture. 他正往墙上钉一枚平头钉用来挂画。||||We are going to tack the map on the wall. 我们打算把这张地图钉在墙上。

name: sardine
example: 单词 sardine 的例句||||Every bus arrives and leaves packed as fully as a sardine tin. 每辆开来和开走的公共汽车都塞得像沙丁鱼罐头一样拥挤。||||As we chatted, a brightly painted sardine boat dropped anchor. 我们正在聊着，只见一条颜色鲜艳的捕捞沙丁鱼的船抛了锚。

name: peripheral
example: 单词 peripheral 的例句||||We dealt with the peripheral aspects of a cost reduction program. 我们谈到了降低成本计划的一些外围问题。||||The hotel provides the clerk the ticket service and the peripheral traveling consultation. 旅舍提供票务服务和周边旅游咨询。

name: perimeter
example: 单词 perimeter 的例句||||The river marks the eastern perimeter of our land. 这条河标示我们的土地东面的边界。||||Drinks in hands, they wandered around the perimeter of the ball field. 他们手里拿着饮料在球场周围漫不经心地遛跶。

name: peril
interpret: n.(严重的)危险；危险的事物；vt.危及；置…于险境
example: 单词 peril 的例句||||The refugees were in peril of death from hunger. 难民有饿死的危险。||||The embankment is in great peril. 河堤岌岌可危。

name: rebuke
example: 单词 rebuke 的例句||||He had to put up with a smart rebuke from the teacher. 他不得不忍受老师的严厉指责。||||Even one minute's lateness would earn a stern rebuke. 哪怕迟到一分钟也将受到严厉的斥责。

name: reactor
example: 单词 reactor 的例句||||The atomic reactor generates enormous amounts of thermal energy. 原子反应堆发出大量的热能。||||Inside the reactor the large molecules are cracked into smaller molecules. 在反应堆里，大分子裂变为小分子。

name: rascal
example: 单词 rascal 的例句||||If he had done otherwise, I should have thought him a rascal. 如果他不这样做，我就认为他是个恶棍。||||The rascal was frightened into holding his tongue. 这坏蛋吓得不敢往下说了。

name: rapture
interpret: n.狂喜；全神贯注；着迷；vt.使狂喜
example: 单词 rapture 的例句||||His speech was received with rapture by his supporters. 他的演说受到支持者们的热烈欢迎。||||In the midst of his rapture, he was interrupted by his father. 他正欢天喜地，被他父亲打断了。

name: peculiarity
interpret: n.独特性，特色；特殊的东西；怪癖
example: 单词 peculiarity 的例句||||Each country has its own peculiarity. 每个国家都有自己的独特之处。||||The peculiarity of this shop is its day and nigth service. 这家商店的特点是昼夜服务。

name: yeast
interpret: n.酵母；酵母片；泡沫；v.发酵；起泡沫
example: 单词 yeast 的例句||||Yeast can be used in making beer and bread. 酵母可用于酿啤酒和发面包。||||The yeast began to work. 酵母开始发酵。

name: ware
example: 单词 ware 的例句||||The shop sells a great variety of porcelain ware. 这家店铺出售品种繁多的瓷器。||||Good ware will never want a chapman. 好货不须叫卖。

name: yearn
example: 单词 yearn 的例句||||We yearn to surrender our entire being. 我们渴望着放纵我们整个的生命。||||Many people living in big cities yearn for an idyllic country life. 现在的很多都市人向往那种田园化的生活。

name: indicator
interpret: n.指标；指示物，指示者；指示器
example: 单词 indicator 的例句||||Gold prices are often seen as an indicator of inflation. 黃金价格常常被看作是通货膨胀的指标。|||| His left-hand indicator is flashing. 他左手边的转向灯正在闪亮。

name: gourmet
interpret: n.食物品尝家；adj.出于美食家之手的
example: 单词 gourmet 的例句||||What does a gourmet writer do?  美食评论家做什么？||||A gourmet like him always eats in expensive restaurants. 像他这样的美食家总是到豪华的餐馆用餐。

name: fraught
interpret: adj.充满…的，伴有(危险等)的；忧虑的
example: 单词 fraught 的例句||||The coming months will be fraught with fateful decisions. 未来数月将充满重大的决定。||||There's no need to look so fraught! 用不着那么愁眉苦脸的!

name: barricade
interpret: n.路障，栅栏，障碍；vt.设路障挡住
example: 单词 barricade 的例句||||The soldiers make a barricade across the road. 士兵在路上设路障。||||It is difficult to break through a steel barricade. 冲破钢铁障碍很难。

name: bust
example: 单词 bust 的例句||||I dropped my camera on the pavement and bust it. 我把照相机掉在人行道上摔坏了。||||She has worked up a lump of clay into a bust. 她把一块黏土精心制作成一个半身像。

name: fortify
interpret: vt.强化防御，为…设防；加强，强化；vi.筑防御工事
example: 单词 fortify 的例句||||This country will fortify the coastal areas. 该国将加强沿海地区的防御。||||This treaty forbade the United States to fortify the canal. 此条约禁止美国对运河设防。

name: trot
interpret: n.疾走，慢跑；n.老太婆；现成译本；(复数）trots:腹泻（与the 连用）；v.小跑，快步走，赶紧
example: 单词 trot 的例句||||They passed me at a trot. 他们从我身边快步走过。||||The horse broke into a brisk trot. 马突然快步小跑起来。

name: pang
interpret: n.剧痛，悲痛，苦闷；vt.使剧痛，折磨
example: 单词 pang 的例句||||She experienced a sharp pang of disappointment. 她经历了失望的巨大痛苦。||||She was beginning to know the pang of disappointed love. 她开始尝到了失恋的痛苦。

name: dissuade
example: 单词 dissuade 的例句||||You'd better dissuade him from doing that. 你最好劝阻他别那样干。||||I tried to dissuade her from investing her money in stocks and shares. 我曾设法劝她不要投资于股票交易。

name: chary
example: 单词 chary 的例句||||She started a chary descent of the stairs. 她开始小心翼翼地下楼梯。||||She is chary of strangers. 她见到陌生人会害羞。

name: oracle
example: 单词 oracle 的例句||||In times of difficulty, she pray for an oracle to guide her. 在困难的时候，她祈祷神谕来指引她。||||It is a kind of oracle that often foretells things most important. 它是一种内生性神谕，常常能预言最重要的事情。

name: complacent
example: 单词 complacent 的例句||||We must not become complacent the moment we have some success. 我们决不能一见成绩就自满起来。||||She was complacent about her achievements. 她对自己的成绩沾沾自喜。

name: revert
interpret: vi.恢复，复归，回到；vt.使回复原状
example: 单词 revert 的例句||||Let us revert to the earlier part of the chapter. 让我们回到本章的前面部分。||||Shall we revert to the matter we talked about yesterday? 我们接着昨天谈过的问题谈，好吗？

name: immunity
example: 单词 immunity 的例句||||The law gives public schools immunity from taxation. 法律免除公立学校的纳税义务。||||He claims diplomatic immunity to avoid being arrested. 他要求外交豁免以便避免被捕。

name: crumb
example: 单词 crumb 的例句||||It was the only crumb of comfort he could salvage from the ordeal. 这是他从这场磨难里能找到的唯一的少许安慰。||||Ruth nearly choked on the last crumb of her pastry. 鲁斯几乎被糕点的最后一块碎屑所噎住。

name: forfeit
example: 单词 forfeit 的例句||||If you continue to tell lies, you will forfeit the good opinion of everyone. 你如果继续撒谎，就会失掉大家对你的好感。||||Please pay for the forfeit before you borrow book. 在你借书之前请先付清罚款。

name: commotion
example: 单词 commotion 的例句||||They made a commotion by yelling at each other in the theatre. 他们在剧院里相互争吵，引起了一阵骚乱。||||Suddenly the whole street was in commotion. 突然间，整条街道变得一片混乱。

name: outgrow
interpret: vt.长大得使…不再适用；成长得不再要
example: 单词 outgrow 的例句||||The little girl will outgrow her fear of pet animals. 小女孩慢慢长大后就不会再怕宠物了。|||| Children who walk in their sleep usually outgrow the habit. 梦游的孩子通常在长大后这个习惯自然消失。

name: caravan
example: 单词 caravan 的例句||||The community adviser gave us a caravan to live in. 社区顾问给了我们一间活动住房栖身。||||Geoff connected the caravan to the car. 杰弗把旅行用的住屋拖车挂在汽车上。

name: conjure
interpret: vt.恳求，祈求；变魔术，变戏法；vi.施魔法；变魔术
example: 单词 conjure 的例句||||I conjure you not to betray me. 我恳求你不要背弃我。||||I can't simply conjure up the money out of thin air. 我是不能像变魔术似的把钱变来。

name: reverberate
interpret: vt.使回响，使反响；vi.回响；反响；弹回；不断发生后效；adj.回响的；反射的
example: 单词 reverberate 的例句||||The decision will reverberate and will jar the country. 这项决定将引起反响并震撼这个国家。||||Echoes of cries of pain reverberate in my heart. 痛苦呼喊的一遍遍的在我的心中回响。

name: irritable
example: 单词 irritable 的例句||||He gets irritable when he's got toothache. 他牙一疼就很容易发脾气。||||Our teacher is an irritable old lady. She gets angry easily. 我们的老师是位脾气急躁的老太太。她很容易生气。

name: mound
interpret: n.土墩，堤，小山；vt.筑堤，用土堆防卫；vi.积成堆
example: 单词 mound 的例句||||The explorers climbed a mound to survey the land around them. 勘探者爬上土丘去勘测周围的土地。||||The mound can be used as our screen. 这个土丘可做我们的掩蔽物。

name: assent
example: 单词 assent 的例句||||I cannot assent to what you ask. 我不能应允你的要求。||||The new bill passed by Parliament has received Royal Assent. 议会所通过的新方案已获国王批准。

name: varnish
example: 单词 varnish 的例句||||He tried to varnish over the facts, but it was useless. 他想粉饰事实，但那是徒劳的。||||He applied varnish to the table. 他给那张桌子涂上清漆。

name: flicker
example: 单词 flicker 的例句||||There was a flicker of lights coming from the abandoned house. 这所废弃的房屋中有灯光闪烁。||||At first, the flame may be a small flicker, barely shining. 开始时，光辉可能是微弱地忽隐忽现, 几乎并不灿烂。

name: lone
example: 单词 lone 的例句||||A lone sea gull flew across the sky. 一只孤独的海鸥在空中飞过。||||She could see a lone figure on the deserted beach. 她在空旷的海滩上能看到一个孤独的身影。

name: bugle
interpret: n.军号，号角，喇叭；vt.&vi.吹号，吹号召集
example: 单词 bugle 的例句||||When he heard the bugle call, he caught up his gun and dashed out. 他一听到军号声就抓起枪冲了出去。||||As the bugle sounded we ran to the sports ground and fell in. 军号一响，我们就跑到运动场集合站队。

name: hermit
example: 单词 hermit 的例句||||He became a hermit after he was dismissed from office. 他被解职后成了隐士。||||Chinese ancient landscape poetry was in natural connections with hermit culture. 中国古代山水诗与隐士文化有着天然联系。

name: ass
example: 单词 ass 的例句||||He is not an ass as they make him. 他不像大家猜想的那样笨。||||An ass endures his burden but not more than his burden. 驴能负重但不能超过它能力所负担的。

name: wield
interpret: vt.行使，运用，支配；挥，使用(武器等)
example: 单词 wield 的例句||||They wield enormous political power. 他们行使巨大的政治权力。||||People may wield the power in a democracy. 在民主国家里，人民可以行使权力。

name: viscous
example: 单词 viscous 的例句||||Gases are much less viscous than liquids. 气体的粘滞性大大小于液体。||||The mud is too viscous. You must have all the agitators run. 泥浆太稠，你们得让所有的搅拌机都开着。

name: annually
example: 单词 annually 的例句||||Many migratory birds visit this lake annually. 许多候鸟每年到这个湖上作短期逗留。||||They celebrate their wedding anniversary annually. 他们每年庆祝一番结婚纪念日。

name: yolk
example: 单词 yolk 的例句||||This dish would be more delicious with some yolk powder. 加点蛋黄粉，这道菜就会更好吃。||||Egg yolk serves as the emulsifying agent in salad dressing. 在色拉调味时，蛋黄能作为乳化剂。

name: yoke
interpret: n.轭；支配；vt.给...上轭，连接，使成配偶；vi.结合；匹配
example: 单词 yoke 的例句||||An ass and an ox, fastened to the same yoke, were drawing a wagon. 驴子和公牛一起套在轭上拉车。||||The defeated army passed under the yoke. 败军在轭门下通过。

name: utilization
example: 单词 utilization 的例句||||Computer has found an increasingly wide utilization in all fields. 电子计算机已越来越广泛地在各个领域得到应用。||||Modern forms of agricultural utilization, have completely refuted this assumption. 现代农业利用形式，完全驳倒了这种想象。

name: tickle
interpret: vt.搔痒，胳肢；使高兴；发痒；vi.觉得痒；（东西）使人发痒；n.搔痒，发痒
example: 单词 tickle 的例句||||Wilson was feeling restless. There was a tickle in his throat. 威尔逊只觉得心神不定。嗓子眼里有些发痒。||||I am tickle pink at the news. 听到这消息我高兴得要命。

name: untie
example: 单词 untie 的例句||||It's just impossible to untie the knot. It's too tight. 这个结根本解不开。太紧了。||||Will you please untie the knot for me? 请你替我解开这个结头，好吗？

name: undertaking
example: 单词 undertaking 的例句||||He gave her an undertaking that he would pay the money back within a year. 他向她做了一年内还钱的保证。||||He is too timid to venture upon an undertaking. 他太胆小，不敢从事任何事业。

name: ultrasonic
example: 单词 ultrasonic 的例句||||It was very necessary for people to take type-B ultrasonic inspection regularly. 定期进行B超检查是十分必要的。||||Sounds are classified into two kinds: sonic and ultrasonic. 声波分为两类，即普通声波与超声波。

name: jingle
interpret: n.叮当声，韵律简单的诗句；v.使叮当作响，叮当响，押韵
example: 单词 jingle 的例句||||The key fell on the ground with a jingle. 钥匙叮当落地。||||The knives and forks set up their regular jingle. 刀叉发出常有的叮当声。

name: hearth
example: 单词 hearth 的例句||||She came and sat in a chair before the hearth. 她走过来，在炉子前面的椅子上坐下。||||She comes to the hearth, and switches on the electric light there. 她走到壁炉那里，打开电灯。

name: haughty
example: 单词 haughty 的例句||||He gave me a haughty look and walked away. 他向我摆出傲慢的表情后走开。||||They were displeased with her haughty airs. 他们讨厌她高傲的派头。

name: hardy
interpret: adj.勇敢的，果断的，吃苦的；耐寒的
example: 单词 hardy 的例句||||The kind of plant is a hardy annual. 这种植物是耐寒的一年生植物。||||He is a hardy person. 他是一个能吃苦耐劳的人。

name: flatten
interpret: vt.&vi.把．．．弄平，使倒伏；使(漆等)失去光泽
example: 单词 flatten 的例句||||We can flatten out a piece of metal by hammering it. 我们可以用锤子把一块金属敲平。||||The wrinkled silk will flatten out if you iron it. 发皱的丝绸可以用熨斗烫平。

name: flannel
example: 单词 flannel 的例句||||She always wears a grey flannel trousers. 她总是穿一条灰色法兰绒长裤。||||She was looking luscious in a flannel shirt. 她穿着法兰绒裙子，看上去楚楚动人。

name: handout
interpret: n.散发的文字材料；救济品
example: 单词 handout 的例句||||I read the handout carefully. 我仔细看了这份分发的资料。||||His job was distributing handouts at the street-corner. 他的工作是在街头发传单。

name: flake
interpret: vt.使成薄片；雪片般落下；vi.剥落；成片状剥落；n.薄片
example: 单词 flake 的例句||||Drain the salmon, discard the skin, crush the bones and flake the salmon with a fork. 将鲑鱼沥干，去表皮，粉碎鱼骨并用餐叉子将鱼肉切成小薄片状。||||The paint's beginning to flake. 油漆开始剥落了。

name: fission
example: 单词 fission 的例句||||The fission of the cell could be inhibited with certain chemicals. 细胞的裂变可以通过某些化学药品加以抑制。||||Nuclear fission releases tremendous amounts of energy. 核裂变释放出巨大的能量。

name: gnaw
interpret: vt.vi.不断地啃、咬；使苦恼，折磨
example: 单词 gnaw 的例句||||Dogs like to gnaw on a bone. 狗爱啃骨头。||||A rat can gnaw a hole through wood. 老鼠能啃穿木头。

name: glossary
example: 单词 glossary 的例句||||The text is supplemented by an adequate glossary. 正文附有一个详细的词汇表。||||For convenience, we have also provided a glossary in an appendix. 为了方便，我们在附录中也提供了术语表。

name: enchant
interpret: vt.使陶醉，使入迷；使着魔，用妖术迷惑
example: 单词 enchant 的例句||||The spectacle of the aurora may appear to dazzle and enchant the observer's eyes. 极光的壮丽景色的出现，会使观察者为之眩目和迷惑。||||Her paintings possess the power to enchant one if one is fortunate enough to see her work and hear her music. 如果你有幸能欣赏她的作品，“聆听”她的音乐，她的作品将深深地迷住你。

name: embroidery
example: 单词 embroidery 的例句||||This exquisite embroidery won people's great admiration. 这件精美的绣品，使人惊叹不已。||||This is Jane's first attempt at embroidery. 这是简第一次试着绣花。

name: eloquence
example: 单词 eloquence 的例句||||I am afraid my eloquence did not avail against the facts. 恐怕我的雄辩也无补于事实了。||||The people were charmed by his eloquence. 人们被他的口才迷住了。

name: gangster
example: 单词 gangster 的例句||||The gangster's friends bought off the police witness. 那匪徒的朋友买通了警察方面的证人。||||He is obviously a gangster, but he pretends to be a saint. 分明是强盗，却要装圣贤。

name: faction
interpret: n.宗派，小集团；派别；派系斗争
example: 单词 faction 的例句||||Faction and self-interest appear to be the norm. 派系之争和自私自利看来非常普遍。||||I now understood clearly that I was caught between the king and the Bunam's faction. 我现在完全明白自己已陷入困境，在国王与布纳姆集团之间左右为难。

name: deposition
interpret: n.免职，罢官；作证；沉淀；沉淀物
example: 单词 deposition 的例句||||It was this issue which led to the deposition of the king. 正是这件事导致了国王被废黜。||||This leads to calcium deposition in the blood-vessels. 这导致钙在血管中沉积。

name: dependant
interpret: n.依靠的，依赖的，依赖他人生活者
example: 单词 dependant 的例句||||The dependent dependant cannot live independently. 依靠别人的被赡养者不能独立生活。||||The fact that the woman is still regarded as the man's dependant. 再加上女人仍被看作是男人的附属品这一事实。

name: earthenware
example: 单词 earthenware 的例句||||She made sure that the glassware and earthenware were always spotlessly clean. 她总是把玻璃器皿和陶器洗刷得干干净净。||||They displayed some bowls of glazed earthenware. 他们展出了一些上釉的陶碗。

name: chestnut
example: 单词 chestnut 的例句||||We have a chestnut tree in the bottom of our garden. 我们的花园尽头有一棵栗树。||||In summer we had tea outdoors, under the chestnut tree. 夏天我们在室外栗树下喝茶。

name: thrifty
example: 单词 thrifty 的例句||||Except for smoking and drinking, he is a thrifty man. 除了抽烟、喝酒，他是个生活节俭的人。||||She was a thrifty woman and managed to put aside some money every month. 她是个很会持家的妇女，每月都设法存些钱。

name: ornamental
interpret: adj.装饰的；作装饰用的；n.装饰品；观赏植物
example: 单词 ornamental 的例句||||The stream was dammed up to form ornamental lakes. 溪流用水坝拦挡起来，形成了装饰性的湖泊。||||The ornamental ironwork lends a touch of elegance to the house. 铁艺饰件为房子略添雅致。

name: ramble
interpret: vi.漫步，漫谈，漫游；vt.漫步于；n.漫步，闲谈，蔓延
example: 单词 ramble 的例句||||This is the best season for a ramble in the suburbs. 这是去郊区漫游的最好季节。||||I like to ramble about the street after work. 我喜欢下班后在街上漫步。

name: obstinate
interpret: adj.顽固的，倔强的，不易屈服的，较难治愈的
example: 单词 obstinate 的例句||||She's too obstinate to let anyone help her. 她太倔强了，不会让任何人帮她的。||||The trader was obstinate in the negotiation. 这个商人在谈判中拗强固执。

name: nourishment
example: 单词 nourishment 的例句||||Lack of proper nourishment reduces their power to resist disease. 营养不良降低了他们抵抗疾病的能力。||||He ventured that plants draw part of their nourishment from the air. 他大胆提出植物从空气中吸收部分养分的观点。

name: mesh
interpret: n.网孔，网丝，陷阱；vt.以网捕捉，啮合，匹配；vi.适合； [计算机]网络
example: 单词 mesh 的例句||||Their characters just don't mesh. 他们的性格就是合不来。||||This is the net having half inch mesh. 这是有半英寸网眼的网。

name: nought
example: 单词 nought 的例句||||We must bring their schemes to nought. 我们必须使他们的阴谋彻底破产。||||One minus one leaves nought. 一减一等于零。

name: lodging
interpret: n.寄宿，住所；(大学生的)校外宿舍
example: 单词 lodging 的例句||||The bill is inclusive of the food and lodging. 账单包括吃、住费用。||||Where can you find lodging for the night? 你今晚在哪里借宿？

name: martyr
interpret: n.烈士，殉难者；vt.杀害，折磨，牺牲
example: 单词 martyr 的例句||||The martyr laid down his life for the cause of national independence. 这位烈士是为了民族独立的事业而献身的。||||The newspaper carried the martyr's photo framed in black. 报上登载了框有黑边的烈士遗像。

name: narration
example: 单词 narration 的例句||||The richness of his novel comes from his narration of it. 他小说的丰富多采得益于他的叙述。||||Narration should become a basic approach to preschool education. 叙事应是幼儿教育的基本途径。

name: malice
example: 单词 malice 的例句||||I detected a suggestion of malice in his remarks. 我觉察出他说的话略带恶意。||||There was a strong current of malice in many of his portraits. 他的许多肖像画中都透着一股强烈的怨恨。

name: leakage
example: 单词 leakage 的例句||||Large areas of land have been contaminated by the leakage from the nuclear reactor. 大片地区都被核反应堆的泄漏物污染了。||||The continuing leakage is the result of the long crack in the pipe. 这根管子上的那一条裂缝致使渗漏不断。

name: lathe
example: 单词 lathe 的例句||||Gradually she learned to operate a lathe. 她慢慢地学会了开车床。||||That lathe went out of order at times. 那台车床有时发生故障。

name: homely
interpret: adj.家常的，简朴的；不漂亮的
example: 单词 homely 的例句||||We had a homely meal of bread and cheese. 我们吃了一顿面包加乳酪的家常便餐。||||Come and have a homely meal with us, will you? 来和我们一起吃顿家常便饭，好吗？

name: inaccurate
interpret: adj.错误的，不正确的，不准确的
example: 单词 inaccurate 的例句||||The book is both inaccurate and exaggerated. 这本书不但不准确，而且夸大其词。||||She never knows the right time because her watch is inaccurate. 她从来不知道准确的时间因为她的表不准。

name: kinetic
example: 单词 kinetic 的例句||||There exist many sources of energy both potential and kinetic. 存在着许多势能和动能的能源。||||The kinetic theory of gases is the best known example. 气体动力学理论就是最有名的例子。

name: kindle
interpret: vt.点燃，着火；vi.发亮；着火；激动起来
example: 单词 kindle 的例句||||This wood is too wet to kindle. 这木柴太湿点不着。||||A small spark was enough to kindle Lily's imagination. 一星光花足以点燃莉丽的全部想象力。

name: kilowatt
example: 单词 kilowatt 的例句||||They pay thirty fen per kilowatt hour. 他们每度电付三角钱。||||The watt is a small unit of power so that we use the kilowatt instead. 瓦特是小功率的单位，因此我们用千瓦代之。

name: implore
example: 单词 implore 的例句||||I implore you to write. At least tell me you're alive. 请给我音讯，让我知道你还活着。||||Please implore someone else's help in a crisis. 危险时请向别人求助。

name: hindrance
example: 单词 hindrance 的例句||||Now they can construct tunnel systems without hindrance. 现在他们可以顺利地建造隧道系统了。||||The heavy baggage was a great hindrance to me. 那件行李成了我的大累赘。

name: fluctuation
interpret: n.(物价的)波动，涨落；周期性变动；脉动
example: 单词 fluctuation 的例句||||The erratic fluctuation of market prices are in consequence of unstable economy. 经济波动致使市场物价忽起忽落。||||Early and adequate drainage is essential if fluctuation occurs. 有波动感时，应及早地充分引流。

name: flux
example: 单词 flux 的例句||||The market is in a constant state of flux. 市场行情在不断变化。||||In most reactors, there is a significant flux of fast neutrons. 在大部分反应堆中都有一定强度的快中子流。

name: fret
interpret: vt.&vi.(使)烦恼；(使)焦急；(使)腐蚀，(使)磨损
example: 单词 fret 的例句||||Don't fret. We'll get there on time. 别着急，我们能准时到那里。||||She'll fret herself to death one of these days. 她总有一天会愁死的.

name: hull
interpret: n.船身；(果、实等的)外壳；vt.去(谷物等)壳
example: 单词 hull 的例句||||The outer surface of ship's hull is very hard. 船体的外表面非常坚硬。||||The boat's hull has been staved in by the tremendous seas. 小船壳让巨浪打穿了。

name: invoice
example: 单词 invoice 的例句||||The seller has to issue a tax invoice. 销售者必须开具税务发票。||||We will then send you an invoice for the total course fees. 然后我们会把全部课程费用的发票寄给你。

name: luminous
interpret: adj.发光的，发亮的；光明的；明白易懂的；有启发的
example: 单词 luminous 的例句||||There are luminous knobs on all the doors in my house. 我家所有门上都安有夜光把手。||||Most clocks and watches in this shop are in luminous paint. 这家商店出售的大多数钟表都涂了发光漆。

name: inorganic
example: 单词 inorganic 的例句||||The fundamentals of inorganic chemistry are very important. 无机化学的基础很重要。||||This chemical plant recently bought a large quantity of inorganic salt. 这家化工厂又买进了大量的无机盐。

name: insignificant
interpret: adj.无关紧要的，可忽略的，无意义的
example: 单词 insignificant 的例句||||In winter the effect was found to be insignificant. 在冬季，这种作用是不明显的。||||This problem was insignificant compared to others she faced. 这一问题与她面临的其他问题比较起来算不得什么。

name: multiplication
interpret: n.增加，增多，倍增；增殖，繁殖；乘法
example: 单词 multiplication 的例句||||Our teacher used to drum our multiplication tables into us. 我们老师过去老是让我们反覆背诵乘法表。||||The multiplication of numbers has made our club building too small. 会员的增加使得我们的俱乐部拥挤不堪。

name: insulator
example: 单词 insulator 的例句||||Few substances can equal fur as an insulator. 作为绝缘体很少有其他材料能与动物皮毛相媲美。||||A loose mulch acts on the surface as an insulator. 疏松的覆盖物在土壤表面起了隔热的作用。

name: miser
example: 单词 miser 的例句||||The miser doesn't like to part with his money. 守财奴舍不得花他的钱。||||The demon of greed ruined the miser's happiness. 贪得无厌的恶习毁掉了那个守财奴的幸福。

name: modulate
interpret: vt.调整，调节(音的强弱)；变调；vi.调制，转调
example: 单词 modulate 的例句||||Please modulate the sound on the TV. 请调节一下电视的音量。||||This system could modulate the voice signal effectively. 这个系统可以对语音信号进行有效的调制。

name: pertinent
interpret: adj.恰当的；贴切的；中肯的；有关的；相干的
example: 单词 pertinent 的例句||||The expert made some pertinent comments on the scheme. 那专家对规划提出了一些中肯的意见。||||These should guide him to pertinent questions for further study. 这些将有助于他进一步研究有关问题。

name: monstrous
interpret: adj.巨大的；恐怖的；可耻的，丢脸的
example: 单词 monstrous 的例句||||The smoke began to whirl and grew into a monstrous column. 浓烟开始盘旋上升，形成了一个巨大的烟柱。||||Your behaviour in class is monstrous! 你在课堂上的行为真是丢人！

name: moor
example: 单词 moor 的例句||||I decided to moor near some tourist boats. 我决定在一些观光船附近停泊。||||There were hundreds of the old huts on the moor. 沼地上有成百上千的古老的石屋。

name: pious
example: 单词 pious 的例句||||Alexander is a pious follower of the faith. 亚历山大是个虔诚的信徒。||||Her mother was a pious Christian. 她母亲是一个虔诚的基督教徒。

name: plunder
interpret: vt.劫掠财物，掠夺；n.劫掠物，赃物；劫掠
example: 单词 plunder 的例句||||The thieves hid their plunder in the cave. 贼把赃物藏在山洞里。||||Trade should not serve as a means of economic plunder. 贸易不应当成为经济掠夺的手段。

name: proficient
interpret: adj.熟练的，精通的；n.能手，专家
example: 单词 proficient 的例句||||She is proficient at swimming. 她精通游泳。||||I think I'm quite proficient in both written and spoken English. 我认为我在英语读写方面相当熟练。

name: prohibition
example: 单词 prohibition 的例句||||The prohibition against drunken driving will save many lives. 禁止酒后开车将会减少许多死亡事故。||||They voted in favour of the prohibition of smoking in public areas. 他们投票赞成禁止在公共场所吸烟。

name: requisite
interpret: adj.需要的，必不可少的；n.必需品
example: 单词 requisite 的例句||||He hasn't got the requisite qualifications for the job. 他不具备这工作所需的资格。||||Food and air are requisite for life. 食物和空气是生命的必需品。

name: inborn
example: 单词 inborn 的例句||||He is a man with an inborn love of joke. 他是一个生来就喜欢开玩笑的人。||||He had an inborn talent for languages. 他有语言天分。

name: paramount
example: 单词 paramount 的例句||||My paramount object is to save the Union and destroy slavery. 我的最高目标是拯救美国，摧毁奴隶制度。||||Nitrogen is of paramount importance to life on earth. 氮对地球上的生命至关重要。

name: maniac
